enumeratedValue.name: SEC_3
enumeratedValue.description: MCU security status is secure

enumeratedValue.name: FSLACC_2
enumeratedValue.description: Freescale factory access denied

enumeratedValue.name: FSLACC_3
enumeratedValue.description: Freescale factory access granted

enumeratedValue.name: MEEN_2
enumeratedValue.description: Mass erase is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: MEEN_3
enumeratedValue.description: Mass erase is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: KEYEN_2

enumeratedValue.name: KEYEN_3
enumeratedValue.description: Backdoor key access disabled

enumeratedValue.name: LPBOOT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Low-power boot

enumeratedValue.name: LPBOOT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Normal boot

enumeratedValue.name: BOOTPIN_OPT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Force Boot from ROM if BOOTCFG0 asserted, where BOOTCFG0 is the boot config function which is muxed with NMI pin

enumeratedValue.name: BOOTPIN_OPT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Boot source configured by FOPT (BOOTSRC_SEL) bits

enumeratedValue.name: NMI_DIS_0
enumeratedValue.description: NMI interrupts are always blocked

enumeratedValue.name: NMI_DIS_1
enumeratedValue.description: NMI_b pin/interrupts reset default to enabled

enumeratedValue.name: RESET_PIN_CFG_0
enumeratedValue.description: RESET pin is disabled following a POR and cannot be enabled as reset function

enumeratedValue.name: RESET_PIN_CFG_1
enumeratedValue.description: RESET_b pin is dedicated

enumeratedValue.name: BOOTSRC_SEL_0
enumeratedValue.description: Boot from Flash

enumeratedValue.name: BOOTSRC_SEL_2
enumeratedValue.description: Boot from ROM

enumeratedValue.name: BOOTSRC_SEL_3
enumeratedValue.description: Boot from ROM

enumeratedValue.name: OCMPU_0
enumeratedValue.description: OCMEMn is not protected by an MPU.

enumeratedValue.name: OCMPU_1
enumeratedValue.description: OCMEMn is protected by an MPU.

field.name: OCMT
field.description: OCMEM Type. This field defines the type of the on-chip memory:

enumeratedValue.name: OCMT_3
enumeratedValue.description: OCMEMn is a ROM.

enumeratedValue.name: OCMT_4
enumeratedValue.description: OCMEMn is a program flash.

enumeratedValue.name: OCMT_5
enumeratedValue.description: OCMEMn is a data flash.

enumeratedValue.name: OCMT_6
enumeratedValue.description: OCMEMn is an EEE.

enumeratedValue.name: RO_0
enumeratedValue.description: writes to the OCMDRn[11:0] are allowed

enumeratedValue.name: RO_1
enumeratedValue.description: writes to the OCMDRn[11:0] are ignored

field.name: OCMW
field.description: OCMEM datapath Width. This read-only field defines the width of the on-chip memory:

enumeratedValue.name: OCMW_2
enumeratedValue.description: OCMEMn 32-bits wide

enumeratedValue.name: OCMW_3
enumeratedValue.description: OCMEMn 64-bits wide

enumeratedValue.name: OCMW_4
enumeratedValue.description: OCMEMn 128-bits wide

enumeratedValue.name: OCMW_5
enumeratedValue.description: OCMEMn 256-bits wide

enumeratedValue.name: OCMSZ_0
enumeratedValue.description: no OCMEMn

enumeratedValue.name: OCMSZ_3
enumeratedValue.description: 4KB OCMEMn

enumeratedValue.name: OCMSZ_4
enumeratedValue.description: 8KB OCMEMn

enumeratedValue.name: OCMSZ_5
enumeratedValue.description: 16KB OCMEMn

enumeratedValue.name: OCMSZ_6
enumeratedValue.description: 32KB OCMEMn

enumeratedValue.name: OCMSZ_7
enumeratedValue.description: 64KB OCMEMn

enumeratedValue.name: OCMSZ_8
enumeratedValue.description: 128KB OCMEMn

enumeratedValue.name: OCMSZ_9
enumeratedValue.description: 256KB OCMEMn

enumeratedValue.name: OCMSZ_10
enumeratedValue.description: 512KB OCMEMn

enumeratedValue.name: OCMSZ_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1024KB OCMEMn

enumeratedValue.name: OCMSZ_12
enumeratedValue.description: 2048KB OCMEMn

enumeratedValue.name: OCMSZ_13
enumeratedValue.description: 4096KB OCMEMn

enumeratedValue.name: OCMSZ_14
enumeratedValue.description: 8192KB OCMEMn

enumeratedValue.name: OCMSZ_15
enumeratedValue.description: 16384KB OCMEMn

enumeratedValue.name: OCMSZH_0
enumeratedValue.description: OCMEMn is a power-of-2 capacity.

enumeratedValue.name: OCMSZH_1
enumeratedValue.description: OCMEMn is not a power-of-2, with a capacity is 0.75 * OCMSZ.

field.name: V
field.description: OCMEM Valid bit. This read-only field defines the validity (presence) of the on-chip memory

enumeratedValue.name: V_0
enumeratedValue.description: OCMEMn is not present.

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: OCMEMn is present.

enumeratedValue.name: EDBG_0
enumeratedValue.description: When in debug mode, the DMA continues to operate.

enumeratedValue.name: EDBG_1
enumeratedValue.description: When in debug mode, the DMA stalls the start of a new channel. Executing channels are allowed to complete. Channel execution resumes when the system exits debug mode or the EDBG bit is cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: ERCA_0
enumeratedValue.description: Fixed priority arbitration is used for channel selection .

enumeratedValue.name: ERCA_1
enumeratedValue.description: Round robin arbitration is used for channel selection .

enumeratedValue.name: HOE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation

enumeratedValue.name: HOE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Any error causes the HALT bit to set. Subsequently, all service requests are ignored until the HALT bit is cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: HALT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation

enumeratedValue.name: HALT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Stall the start of any new channels. Executing channels are allowed to complete. Channel execution resumes when this bit is cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: CLM_0
enumeratedValue.description: A minor loop channel link made to itself goes through channel arbitration before being activated again.

enumeratedValue.name: CLM_1
enumeratedValue.description: A minor loop channel link made to itself does not go through channel arbitration before being activated again. Upon minor loop completion, the channel activates again if that channel has a minor loop channel link enabled and the link channel is itself. This effectively applies the minor loop offsets and restarts the next minor loop.

enumeratedValue.name: EMLM_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. TCDn.word2 is defined as a 32-bit NBYTES field.

enumeratedValue.name: EMLM_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. TCDn.word2 is redefined to include individual enable fields, an offset field, and the NBYTES field. The individual enable fields allow the minor loop offset to be applied to the source address, the destination address, or both. The NBYTES field is reduced when either offset is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ECX_0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation

enumeratedValue.name: ECX_1
enumeratedValue.description: Cancel the remaining data transfer in the same fashion as the CX bit. Stop the executing channel and force the minor loop to finish. The cancel takes effect after the last write of the current read/write sequence. The ECX bit clears itself after the cancel is honored. In addition to cancelling the transfer, ECX treats the cancel as an error condition, thus updating the Error Status register (DMAx_ES) and generating an optional error interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: CX_0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation

enumeratedValue.name: CX_1
enumeratedValue.description: Cancel the remaining data transfer. Stop the executing channel and force the minor loop to finish. The cancel takes effect after the last write of the current read/write sequence. The CX bit clears itself after the cancel has been honored. This cancel retires the channel normally as if the minor loop was completed.

enumeratedValue.name: DBE_0
enumeratedValue.description: No destination bus error

enumeratedValue.name: DBE_1
enumeratedValue.description: The last recorded error was a bus error on a destination write

enumeratedValue.name: SBE_0
enumeratedValue.description: No source bus error

enumeratedValue.name: SBE_1
enumeratedValue.description: The last recorded error was a bus error on a source read

enumeratedValue.name: SGE_0
enumeratedValue.description: No scatter/gather configuration error

enumeratedValue.name: SGE_1
enumeratedValue.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DLASTSGA field. This field is checked at the beginning of a scatter/gather operation after major loop completion if TCDn_CSR[ESG] is enabled. TCDn_DLASTSGA is not on a 32 byte boundary.

enumeratedValue.name: NCE_0
enumeratedValue.description: No NBYTES/CITER configuration error

enumeratedValue.name: NCE_1
enumeratedValue.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_NBYTES or TCDn_CITER fields. TCDn_NBYTES is not a multiple of TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE] and TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE], or TCDn_CITER[CITER] is equal to zero, or TCDn_CITER[ELINK] is not equal to TCDn_BITER[ELINK]

enumeratedValue.name: DOE_0
enumeratedValue.description: No destination offset configuration error

enumeratedValue.name: DOE_1
enumeratedValue.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DOFF field. TCDn_DOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].

enumeratedValue.name: DAE_0
enumeratedValue.description: No destination address configuration error

enumeratedValue.name: DAE_1
enumeratedValue.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DADDR field. TCDn_DADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].

enumeratedValue.name: SOE_0
enumeratedValue.description: No source offset configuration error

enumeratedValue.name: SOE_1
enumeratedValue.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SOFF field. TCDn_SOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].

enumeratedValue.name: SAE_0
enumeratedValue.description: No source address configuration error.

enumeratedValue.name: SAE_1
enumeratedValue.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SADDR field. TCDn_SADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].

field.name: ERRCHN
field.description: Error Channel Number or Canceled Channel Number

enumeratedValue.name: CPE_0
enumeratedValue.description: No channel priority error

enumeratedValue.name: CPE_1
enumeratedValue.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error in the channel priorities . Channel priorities are not unique.

enumeratedValue.name: ECX_0
enumeratedValue.description: No canceled transfers

enumeratedValue.name: ECX_1
enumeratedValue.description: The last recorded entry was a canceled transfer by the error cancel transfer input

field.name: VLD
field.description: Logical OR of all ERR status bits

enumeratedValue.name: VLD_0
enumeratedValue.description: No ERR bits are set.

enumeratedValue.name: VLD_1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one ERR bit is set indicating a valid error exists that has not been cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: ERQ0_1
enumeratedValue.description: The DMA request signal for the corresponding channel is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: DPA_0
enumeratedValue.description: Channel n can suspend a lower priority channel.

enumeratedValue.name: DPA_1
enumeratedValue.description: Channel n cannot suspend any channel, regardless of channel priority.

enumeratedValue.name: ECP_0
enumeratedValue.description: Channel n cannot be suspended by a higher priority channel's service request.

enumeratedValue.name: ECP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Channel n can be temporarily suspended by the service request of a higher priority channel.

enumeratedValue.name: SSIZE_0
enumeratedValue.description: 8-bit

enumeratedValue.name: SSIZE_1
enumeratedValue.description: 16-bit

enumeratedValue.name: SSIZE_2
enumeratedValue.description: 32-bit

enumeratedValue.name: SSIZE_4
enumeratedValue.description: 16-byte burst

enumeratedValue.name: SSIZE_5
enumeratedValue.description: 32-byte burst

enumeratedValue.name: SMOD_0

register.name: TCD%s_NBYTES_MLNO
register.description: TCD Minor Byte Count (Minor Loop Mapping Disabled)

register.name: TCD%s_NBYTES_MLOFFNO
register.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping Enabled and Offset Disabled)

enumeratedValue.name: DMLOE_0
enumeratedValue.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the DADDR

enumeratedValue.name: DMLOE_1
enumeratedValue.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the DADDR

enumeratedValue.name: SMLOE_0
enumeratedValue.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the SADDR

enumeratedValue.name: SMLOE_1
enumeratedValue.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the SADDR

register.name: TCD%s_NBYTES_MLOFFYES
register.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping and Offset Enabled)

field.name: MLOFF
field.description: If SMLOE or DMLOE is set, this field represents a sign-extended offset applied to the source or destination address to form the next-state value after the minor loop completes.

enumeratedValue.name: DMLOE_0
enumeratedValue.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the DADDR

enumeratedValue.name: DMLOE_1
enumeratedValue.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the DADDR

enumeratedValue.name: SMLOE_0
enumeratedValue.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the SADDR

enumeratedValue.name: SMLOE_1
enumeratedValue.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the SADDR

register.name: TCD%s_CITER_ELINKNO
register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

field.name: ELINK
field.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

enumeratedValue.name: ELINK_0
enumeratedValue.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: ELINK_1
enumeratedValue.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

register.name: TCD%s_CITER_ELINKYES
register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

field.name: ELINK
field.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

enumeratedValue.name: ELINK_0
enumeratedValue.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: ELINK_1
enumeratedValue.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

register.name: TCD%s_DLASTSGA
register.description: TCD Last Destination Address Adjustment/Scatter Gather Address

field.name: DLASTSGA
field.description: Destination last address adjustment or the memory address for the next transfer control descriptor to be loaded into this channel (scatter/gather)

enumeratedValue.name: START_0
enumeratedValue.description: The channel is not explicitly started.

enumeratedValue.name: START_1
enumeratedValue.description: The channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request.

field.name: INTMAJOR
field.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

enumeratedValue.name: INTMAJOR_0
enumeratedValue.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: INTMAJOR_1
enumeratedValue.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is enabled.

field.name: INTHALF
field.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

enumeratedValue.name: INTHALF_0
enumeratedValue.description: The half-point interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: INTHALF_1
enumeratedValue.description: The half-point interrupt is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DREQ_0
enumeratedValue.description: The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.

enumeratedValue.name: DREQ_1
enumeratedValue.description: The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.

enumeratedValue.name: ESG_0
enumeratedValue.description: The current channel's TCD is normal format.

enumeratedValue.name: ESG_1
enumeratedValue.description: The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

field.name: MAJORELINK
field.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

enumeratedValue.name: MAJORELINK_0
enumeratedValue.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: MAJORELINK_1
enumeratedValue.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: BWC_0
enumeratedValue.description: No eDMA engine stalls.

enumeratedValue.name: BWC_2
enumeratedValue.description: eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each R/W.

enumeratedValue.name: BWC_3
enumeratedValue.description: eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each R/W.

register.name: TCD%s_BITER_ELINKNO
register.description: TCD Beginning Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

field.name: ELINK
field.description: Enables channel-to-channel linking on minor loop complete

enumeratedValue.name: ELINK_0
enumeratedValue.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: ELINK_1
enumeratedValue.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

register.name: TCD%s_BITER_ELINKYES
register.description: TCD Beginning Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

field.name: ELINK
field.description: Enables channel-to-channel linking on minor loop complete

enumeratedValue.name: ELINK_0
enumeratedValue.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: ELINK_1
enumeratedValue.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: VLD_0
enumeratedValue.description: MPU is disabled. All accesses from all bus masters are allowed.

enumeratedValue.name: VLD_1
enumeratedValue.description: MPU is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: NRGD_0
enumeratedValue.description: 8 region descriptors

enumeratedValue.name: NRGD_1
enumeratedValue.description: 12 region descriptors

enumeratedValue.name: NRGD_2
enumeratedValue.description: 16 region descriptors

enumeratedValue.description: No error has occurred for slave port n.

enumeratedValue.name: SPERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: An error has occurred for slave port n.

enumeratedValue.name: M3UM_1
enumeratedValue.description: Allows the given access type to occur

enumeratedValue.name: M3SM_0

enumeratedValue.name: M3SM_1

enumeratedValue.name: M3SM_2

enumeratedValue.name: M3SM_3

enumeratedValue.name: M3PE_1

field.name: MGSTAT0
field.description: Memory Controller Command Completion Status Flag

enumeratedValue.name: FPVIOL_0
enumeratedValue.description: No protection violation detected

enumeratedValue.name: FPVIOL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Protection violation detected

enumeratedValue.name: ACCERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: No access error detected

enumeratedValue.name: ACCERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Access error detected

enumeratedValue.name: RDCOLERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: No collision error detected

enumeratedValue.name: RDCOLERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Collision error detected

enumeratedValue.name: CCIF_0
enumeratedValue.description: FTFE command or EEPROM file system operation in progress

enumeratedValue.name: CCIF_1
enumeratedValue.description: FTFE command or EEPROM file system operation has completed

field.name: EEERDY
field.description: This flag indicates if the EEPROM backup data has been copied to the FlexRAM and is therefore available for read access

enumeratedValue.name: EEERDY_0
enumeratedValue.description: FlexRAM is not available for EEPROM operation

enumeratedValue.name: EEERDY_1
enumeratedValue.description: FlexRAM is available for EEPROM operations where: reads from the FlexRAM return data previously written to the FlexRAM in EEPROM mode and writes launch an EEPROM operation to store the written data in the FlexRAM and EEPROM backup

enumeratedValue.name: RAMRDY_0
enumeratedValue.description: FlexRAM is not available for traditional RAM access

enumeratedValue.name: RAMRDY_1
enumeratedValue.description: FlexRAM is available as traditional RAM only; writes to the FlexRAM do not trigger EEPROM operations

enumeratedValue.name: PFLSH_0
enumeratedValue.description: FTFE configuration supports one program flash block and one FlexNVM block

enumeratedValue.name: ERSSUSP_0
enumeratedValue.description: No suspend requested

enumeratedValue.name: ERSSUSP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Suspend the current Erase Flash Sector command execution

enumeratedValue.name: ERSAREQ_0
enumeratedValue.description: No request or request complete

enumeratedValue.name: ERSAREQ_1
enumeratedValue.description: Request to: run the Erase All Blocks command, verify the erased state, program the security byte in the Flash Configuration Field to the unsecure state, and release MCU security by setting the FSEC[SEC] field to the unsecure state

enumeratedValue.name: RDCOLLIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Read collision error interrupt disabled

enumeratedValue.name: RDCOLLIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Read collision error interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever an FTFE read collision error is detected (see the description of FSTAT[RDCOLERR]).

enumeratedValue.name: CCIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Command complete interrupt disabled

enumeratedValue.name: CCIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Command complete interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever the FSTAT[CCIF] flag is set.

enumeratedValue.name: SEC_0
enumeratedValue.description: MCU security status is secure

enumeratedValue.name: SEC_1
enumeratedValue.description: MCU security status is secure

enumeratedValue.name: SEC_2
enumeratedValue.description: MCU security status is unsecure (The standard shipping condition of the FTFE is unsecure.)

enumeratedValue.name: SEC_3
enumeratedValue.description: MCU security status is secure

enumeratedValue.name: FSLACC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Factory access granted

enumeratedValue.name: FSLACC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Factory access denied

enumeratedValue.name: FSLACC_2
enumeratedValue.description: Factory access denied

enumeratedValue.name: FSLACC_3
enumeratedValue.description: Factory access granted

enumeratedValue.name: MEEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Mass erase is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: MEEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Mass erase is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: MEEN_2
enumeratedValue.description: Mass erase is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: MEEN_3
enumeratedValue.description: Mass erase is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: KEYEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Backdoor key access disabled

enumeratedValue.name: KEYEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Backdoor key access disabled (preferred KEYEN state to disable backdoor key access)

enumeratedValue.name: KEYEN_2
enumeratedValue.description: Backdoor key access enabled

enumeratedValue.name: KEYEN_3
enumeratedValue.description: Backdoor key access disabled

field.name: CCOBn
field.description: The FCCOB register provides a command code and relevant parameters to the memory controller

enumeratedValue.name: PROT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Program flash region is protected.

enumeratedValue.name: PROT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Program flash region is not protected

enumeratedValue.name: EPROT_0
enumeratedValue.description: EEPROM region is protected

enumeratedValue.name: EPROT_1
enumeratedValue.description: EEPROM region is not protected

enumeratedValue.name: DPROT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Data Flash region is protected

enumeratedValue.name: DPROT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Data Flash region is not protected

enumeratedValue.name: XA_0
enumeratedValue.description: Associated segment is accessible in execute mode only (as an instruction fetch)

enumeratedValue.name: XA_1
enumeratedValue.description: Associated segment is accessible as data or in execute mode

enumeratedValue.name: SA_0
enumeratedValue.description: Associated segment is accessible in supervisor mode only

enumeratedValue.name: SA_1
enumeratedValue.description: Associated segment is accessible in user or supervisor mode

enumeratedValue.name: NUMSG_48
enumeratedValue.description: Program flash memory is divided into 48 segments (768 Kbytes, 1.5 Mbytes)

enumeratedValue.name: NUMSG_64
enumeratedValue.description: Program flash memory is divided into 64 segments (256 Kbytes, 512 Kbytes, 1 Mbyte, 2 Mbytes)

field.name: DFDIF
field.description: Double Bit Fault Detect Interrupt Flag

enumeratedValue.name: DFDIF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Double bit fault not detected during a valid flash read access from the platform flash controller

enumeratedValue.name: DFDIF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Double bit fault detected (or FERCNFG[FDFD] is set) during a valid flash read access from the platform flash controller

field.name: DFDIE
field.description: Double Bit Fault Detect Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.name: DFDIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Double bit fault detect interrupt disabled

enumeratedValue.name: DFDIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Double bit fault detect interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever the FERSTAT[DFDIF] flag is set.

enumeratedValue.name: FDFD_0
enumeratedValue.description: FERSTAT[DFDIF] sets only if a double bit fault is detected during read access from the platform flash controller

enumeratedValue.name: FDFD_1
enumeratedValue.description: FERSTAT[DFDIF] sets during any valid flash read access from the platform flash controller. An interrupt request is generated if the DFDIE bit is set.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Triggering is disabled. If triggering is disabled and ENBL is set, the DMA Channel will simply route the specified source to the DMA channel. (Normal mode)

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Triggering is enabled. If triggering is enabled and ENBL is set, the DMAMUX is in Periodic Trigger mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: DMA channel is disabled. This mode is primarily used during configuration of the DMAMux. The DMA has separate channel enables/disables, which should be used to disable or reconfigure a DMA channel.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: DMA channel is enabled

field.name: MAXMB
field.description: Number Of The Last Message Buffer

enumeratedValue.name: IDAM_0
enumeratedValue.description: Format A: One full ID (standard and extended) per ID Filter Table element.

enumeratedValue.name: IDAM_1
enumeratedValue.description: Format B: Two full standard IDs or two partial 14-bit (standard and extended) IDs per ID Filter Table element.

enumeratedValue.name: IDAM_2
enumeratedValue.description: Format C: Four partial 8-bit Standard IDs per ID Filter Table element.

enumeratedValue.name: IDAM_3
enumeratedValue.description: Format D: All frames rejected.

enumeratedValue.name: AEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Abort disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: AEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Abort enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: LPRIOEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Local Priority disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: LPRIOEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Local Priority enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DMA_0
enumeratedValue.description: DMA feature for RX FIFO disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DMA_1
enumeratedValue.description: DMA feature for RX FIFO enabled.

field.name: IRMQ
field.description: Individual Rx Masking And Queue Enable

enumeratedValue.name: IRMQ_0
enumeratedValue.description: Individual Rx masking and queue feature are disabled. For backward compatibility with legacy applications, the reading of C/S word locks the MB even if it is EMPTY.

enumeratedValue.name: IRMQ_1
enumeratedValue.description: Individual Rx masking and queue feature are enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: SRXDIS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Self reception enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: SRXDIS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Self reception disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: WAKSRC_0
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN uses the unfiltered Rx input to detect recessive to dominant edges on the CAN bus.

enumeratedValue.name: WAKSRC_1
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN uses the filtered Rx input to detect recessive to dominant edges on the CAN bus.

enumeratedValue.name: LPMACK_0
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN is not in a low-power mode.

enumeratedValue.name: LPMACK_1
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN is in a low-power mode.

enumeratedValue.name: WRNEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: TWRNINT and RWRNINT bits are zero, independent of the values in the error counters.

enumeratedValue.name: WRNEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: TWRNINT and RWRNINT bits are set when the respective error counter transitions from less than 96 to greater than or equal to 96.

enumeratedValue.name: SLFWAK_0
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN Self Wake Up feature is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: SLFWAK_1
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN Self Wake Up feature is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: SUPV_0
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN is in User mode. Affected registers allow both Supervisor and Unrestricted accesses.

enumeratedValue.name: SUPV_1
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN is in Supervisor mode. Affected registers allow only Supervisor access. Unrestricted access behaves as though the access was done to an unimplemented register location.

enumeratedValue.name: FRZACK_0
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN not in Freeze mode, prescaler running.

enumeratedValue.name: FRZACK_1
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN in Freeze mode, prescaler stopped.

enumeratedValue.name: SOFTRST_0
enumeratedValue.description: No reset request.

enumeratedValue.name: SOFTRST_1
enumeratedValue.description: Resets the registers affected by soft reset.

enumeratedValue.name: WAKMSK_0
enumeratedValue.description: Wake Up Interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: WAKMSK_1
enumeratedValue.description: Wake Up Interrupt is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: NOTRDY_0
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN module is either in Normal mode, Listen-Only mode or Loop-Back mode.

enumeratedValue.name: NOTRDY_1
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN module is either in Disable mode, Stop mode or Freeze mode.

enumeratedValue.name: HALT_0
enumeratedValue.description: No Freeze mode request.

enumeratedValue.name: HALT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enters Freeze mode if the FRZ bit is asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: RFEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Rx FIFO not enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: RFEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Rx FIFO enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: FRZ_0
enumeratedValue.description: Not enabled to enter Freeze mode.

enumeratedValue.name: FRZ_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled to enter Freeze mode.

enumeratedValue.name: MDIS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the FlexCAN module.

enumeratedValue.name: MDIS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the FlexCAN module.

enumeratedValue.name: LOM_0
enumeratedValue.description: Listen-Only mode is deactivated.

enumeratedValue.name: LOM_1
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN module operates in Listen-Only mode.

enumeratedValue.name: LBUF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Buffer with highest priority is transmitted first.

enumeratedValue.name: LBUF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Lowest number buffer is transmitted first.

enumeratedValue.name: TSYN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Sync feature disabled

enumeratedValue.name: TSYN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Sync feature enabled

enumeratedValue.name: BOFFREC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic recovering from Bus Off state enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: BOFFREC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic recovering from Bus Off state disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: SMP_0
enumeratedValue.description: Just one sample is used to determine the bit value.

enumeratedValue.name: SMP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Three samples are used to determine the value of the received bit: the regular one (sample point) and 2 preceding samples; a majority rule is used.

enumeratedValue.name: RWRNMSK_0
enumeratedValue.description: Rx Warning Interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: RWRNMSK_1
enumeratedValue.description: Rx Warning Interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TWRNMSK_0
enumeratedValue.description: Tx Warning Interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TWRNMSK_1
enumeratedValue.description: Tx Warning Interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: LPB_0
enumeratedValue.description: Loop Back disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: LPB_1
enumeratedValue.description: Loop Back enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: CLKSRC_0
enumeratedValue.description: The CAN engine clock source is the oscillator clock. Under this condition, the oscillator clock frequency must be lower than the bus clock.

enumeratedValue.name: CLKSRC_1
enumeratedValue.description: The CAN engine clock source is the peripheral clock.

enumeratedValue.name: ERRMSK_0
enumeratedValue.description: Error interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ERRMSK_1
enumeratedValue.description: Error interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: BOFFMSK_0
enumeratedValue.description: Bus Off interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: BOFFMSK_1
enumeratedValue.description: Bus Off interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: MG_0
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is "don't care."

enumeratedValue.name: MG_1
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is checked.

enumeratedValue.name: RX14M_0
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is "don't care."

enumeratedValue.name: RX14M_1
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is checked.

enumeratedValue.name: RX15M_0
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is "don't care."

enumeratedValue.name: RX15M_1
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is checked.

enumeratedValue.name: WAKINT_0
enumeratedValue.description: No such occurrence.

enumeratedValue.name: WAKINT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Indicates a recessive to dominant transition was received on the CAN bus.

enumeratedValue.name: ERRINT_0
enumeratedValue.description: No such occurrence.

enumeratedValue.name: ERRINT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Indicates setting of any Error Bit in the Error and Status Register.

enumeratedValue.name: BOFFINT_0
enumeratedValue.description: No such occurrence.

enumeratedValue.name: BOFFINT_1
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN module entered Bus Off state.

enumeratedValue.name: RX_0
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN is not receiving a message.

enumeratedValue.name: RX_1
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN is receiving a message.

enumeratedValue.name: FLTCONF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Error Active

enumeratedValue.name: FLTCONF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Error Passive

enumeratedValue.name: FLTCONF_2
enumeratedValue.description: Bus Off

enumeratedValue.name: TX_0
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN is not transmitting a message.

enumeratedValue.name: TX_1
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN is transmitting a message.

field.name: IDLE
field.description: This bit indicates when CAN bus is in IDLE state

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE_0
enumeratedValue.description: No such occurrence.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE_1
enumeratedValue.description: CAN bus is now IDLE.

enumeratedValue.name: RXWRN_0
enumeratedValue.description: No such occurrence.

enumeratedValue.name: RXWRN_1
enumeratedValue.description: RXERRCNT is greater than or equal to 96.

enumeratedValue.name: TXWRN_0
enumeratedValue.description: No such occurrence.

enumeratedValue.name: TXWRN_1
enumeratedValue.description: TXERRCNT is greater than or equal to 96.

enumeratedValue.name: STFERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: No such occurrence.

enumeratedValue.name: STFERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: A Stuffing Error occurred since last read of this register.

enumeratedValue.name: FRMERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: No such occurrence.

enumeratedValue.name: FRMERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: A Form Error occurred since last read of this register.

enumeratedValue.name: CRCERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: No such occurrence.

enumeratedValue.name: CRCERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: A CRC error occurred since last read of this register.

enumeratedValue.name: ACKERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: No such occurrence.

enumeratedValue.name: ACKERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: An ACK error occurred since last read of this register.

enumeratedValue.name: BIT0ERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: No such occurrence.

enumeratedValue.name: BIT0ERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one bit sent as dominant is received as recessive.

enumeratedValue.name: BIT1ERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: No such occurrence.

enumeratedValue.name: BIT1ERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one bit sent as recessive is received as dominant.

enumeratedValue.name: RWRNINT_0
enumeratedValue.description: No such occurrence.

enumeratedValue.name: RWRNINT_1
enumeratedValue.description: The Rx error counter transitioned from less than 96 to greater than or equal to 96.

enumeratedValue.name: TWRNINT_0
enumeratedValue.description: No such occurrence.

enumeratedValue.name: TWRNINT_1
enumeratedValue.description: The Tx error counter transitioned from less than 96 to greater than or equal to 96.

enumeratedValue.name: SYNCH_0
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN is not synchronized to the CAN bus.

enumeratedValue.name: SYNCH_1
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN is synchronized to the CAN bus.

enumeratedValue.name: BOFFDONEINT_0
enumeratedValue.description: No such occurrence.

enumeratedValue.name: BOFFDONEINT_1
enumeratedValue.description: FlexCAN module has completed Bus Off process.

enumeratedValue.name: ERROVR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Overrun has not occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: ERROVR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Overrun has occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: BUF31TO0M_0
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding buffer Interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: BUF31TO0M_1
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding buffer Interrupt is enabled.

field.name: BUF0I
field.description: Buffer MB0 Interrupt Or Clear FIFO bit

enumeratedValue.name: BUF0I_0
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding buffer has no occurrence of successfully completed transmission or reception when MCR[RFEN]=0.

enumeratedValue.name: BUF0I_1
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding buffer has successfully completed transmission or reception when MCR[RFEN]=0.

enumeratedValue.name: BUF4TO1I_0
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding buffer has no occurrence of successfully completed transmission or reception when MCR[RFEN]=0.

enumeratedValue.name: BUF4TO1I_1
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding buffer has successfully completed transmission or reception when MCR[RFEN]=0.

field.name: BUF5I
field.description: Buffer MB5 Interrupt Or "Frames available in Rx FIFO"

enumeratedValue.name: BUF5I_0
enumeratedValue.description: No occurrence of MB5 completing transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or of frame(s) available in the FIFO, when MCR[RFEN]=1

enumeratedValue.name: BUF5I_1
enumeratedValue.description: MB5 completed transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or frame(s) available in the Rx FIFO when MCR[RFEN]=1. It generates a DMA request in case of MCR[RFEN] and MCR[DMA] are enabled.

field.name: BUF6I
field.description: Buffer MB6 Interrupt Or "Rx FIFO Warning"

enumeratedValue.name: BUF6I_0
enumeratedValue.description: No occurrence of MB6 completing transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or of Rx FIFO almost full when MCR[RFEN]=1

enumeratedValue.name: BUF6I_1
enumeratedValue.description: MB6 completed transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or Rx FIFO almost full when MCR[RFEN]=1

field.name: BUF7I
field.description: Buffer MB7 Interrupt Or "Rx FIFO Overflow"

enumeratedValue.name: BUF7I_0
enumeratedValue.description: No occurrence of MB7 completing transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or of Rx FIFO overflow when MCR[RFEN]=1

enumeratedValue.name: BUF7I_1
enumeratedValue.description: MB7 completed transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or Rx FIFO overflow when MCR[RFEN]=1

enumeratedValue.name: BUF31TO8I_0
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding buffer has no occurrence of successfully completed transmission or reception.

enumeratedValue.name: BUF31TO8I_1
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding buffer has successfully completed transmission or reception.

enumeratedValue.name: EDFLTDIS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Edge Filter is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: EDFLTDIS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Edge Filter is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ISOCANFDEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Stuff Count feature is disabled. Stuff Count bit field is not inserted before the CRC Sequence field.

enumeratedValue.name: ISOCANFDEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Stuff Count feature is enabled. Stuff Count bit field is inserted before the CRC Sequence field.

enumeratedValue.name: PREXCEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Protocol Exception is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PREXCEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Protocol Exception is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMER_SRC_0
enumeratedValue.description: The Free Running Timer is clocked by the CAN bit clock, which defines the baud rate on the CAN bus.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMER_SRC_1
enumeratedValue.description: The Free Running Timer is clocked by an external time tick. The period can be either adjusted to be equal to the baud rate on the CAN bus, or a different value as required. See the device specific section for details about the external time tick.

field.name: EACEN
field.description: Entire Frame Arbitration Field Comparison Enable For Rx Mailboxes

enumeratedValue.name: EACEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Rx Mailbox filter's IDE bit is always compared and RTR is never compared despite mask bits.

enumeratedValue.name: EACEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enables the comparison of both Rx Mailbox filter's IDE and RTR bit with their corresponding bits within the incoming frame. Mask bits do apply.

enumeratedValue.name: RRS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Remote Response Frame is generated.

enumeratedValue.name: RRS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Remote Request Frame is stored.

enumeratedValue.name: MRP_0
enumeratedValue.description: Matching starts from Rx FIFO and continues on Mailboxes.

enumeratedValue.name: MRP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Matching starts from Mailboxes and continues on Rx FIFO.

enumeratedValue.name: BOFFDONEMSK_0
enumeratedValue.description: Bus Off Done interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: BOFFDONEMSK_1
enumeratedValue.description: Bus Off Done interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: IMB_0
enumeratedValue.description: If ESR2[VPS] is asserted, the ESR2[LPTM] is not an inactive Mailbox.

enumeratedValue.name: IMB_1
enumeratedValue.description: If ESR2[VPS] is asserted, there is at least one inactive Mailbox. LPTM content is the number of the first one.

enumeratedValue.name: VPS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Contents of IMB and LPTM are invalid.

enumeratedValue.name: VPS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Contents of IMB and LPTM are valid.

enumeratedValue.name: FGM_0
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is "don't care."

enumeratedValue.name: FGM_1
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is checked.

enumeratedValue.name: BTF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Extended bit time definitions disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: BTF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Extended bit time definitions enabled.

field.name: TIME_STAMP
field.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

field.name: DLC
field.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

field.name: RTR
field.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

field.name: IDE
field.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

field.name: SRR
field.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

field.name: EXT
field.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

field.name: STD
field.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

field.name: PRIO
field.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

field.name: PRIO
field.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

field.name: TIME_STAMP
field.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

field.name: DLC
field.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

field.name: RTR
field.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

field.name: IDE
field.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

field.name: SRR
field.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

field.name: EXT
field.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

field.name: STD
field.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

field.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

field.name: DLC
field.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

field.name: RTR
field.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

field.name: IDE
field.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

field.name: SRR
field.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

field.name: EXT
field.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

field.name: STD
field.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

enumeratedValue.name: MI_0
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is "don't care."

enumeratedValue.name: MI_1
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is checked.

enumeratedValue.name: FEATURE_4
enumeratedValue.description: Standard feature set supporting 32-bit shift register.

enumeratedValue.name: MEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Module is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: MEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Module is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: RST_0
enumeratedValue.description: Master logic is not reset.

enumeratedValue.name: RST_1
enumeratedValue.description: Master logic is reset.

enumeratedValue.name: DOZEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Module is enabled in Doze mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DOZEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Module is disabled in Doze mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DBGEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Module is disabled in debug mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DBGEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Module is enabled in debug mode.

enumeratedValue.name: RTF_0
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: RTF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO is reset.

enumeratedValue.name: RRF_0
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: RRF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO is reset.

enumeratedValue.name: TDF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit data not requested.

enumeratedValue.name: TDF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit data is requested.

enumeratedValue.name: RDF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Receive Data is not ready.

enumeratedValue.name: RDF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive data is ready.

enumeratedValue.name: WCF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Transfer word not completed.

enumeratedValue.name: WCF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Transfer word completed.

enumeratedValue.name: FCF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Frame transfer has not completed.

enumeratedValue.name: FCF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Frame transfer has completed.

enumeratedValue.name: TCF_0
enumeratedValue.description: All transfers have not completed.

enumeratedValue.name: TCF_1
enumeratedValue.description: All transfers have completed.

enumeratedValue.name: TEF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO underrun has not occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: TEF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO underrun has occurred

enumeratedValue.name: REF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO has not overflowed.

enumeratedValue.name: REF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO has overflowed.

enumeratedValue.name: DMF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Have not received matching data.

enumeratedValue.name: DMF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Have received matching data.

enumeratedValue.name: MBF_0
enumeratedValue.description: LPSPI is idle.

enumeratedValue.name: MBF_1
enumeratedValue.description: LPSPI is busy.

enumeratedValue.name: TDIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TDIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt enabled

enumeratedValue.name: RDIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: RDIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: WCIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: WCIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: FCIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: FCIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TCIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TCIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TEIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TEIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: REIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: REIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DMIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DMIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TDDE_0
enumeratedValue.description: DMA request disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TDDE_1
enumeratedValue.description: DMA request enabled

enumeratedValue.name: RDDE_0
enumeratedValue.description: DMA request disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: RDDE_1
enumeratedValue.description: DMA request enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: HREN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Host request is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: HREN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Host request is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: HRPOL_1

enumeratedValue.name: HRSEL_1

enumeratedValue.name: CIRFIFO_0

enumeratedValue.name: CIRFIFO_1
enumeratedValue.description: Circular FIFO is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: RDMO_0
enumeratedValue.description: Received data is stored in the receive FIFO as normal.

enumeratedValue.name: RDMO_1
enumeratedValue.description: Received data is discarded unless the DMF is set.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_0
enumeratedValue.description: Slave mode.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_1
enumeratedValue.description: Master mode.

enumeratedValue.name: SAMPLE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Input data sampled on SCK edge.

enumeratedValue.name: SAMPLE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Input data sampled on delayed SCK edge.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTOPCS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic PCS generation disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTOPCS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic PCS generation enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: NOSTALL_0
enumeratedValue.description: Transfers will stall when transmit FIFO is empty or receive FIFO is full.

enumeratedValue.name: NOSTALL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Transfers will not stall, allowing transmit FIFO underrun or receive FIFO overrun to occur.

enumeratedValue.name: PCSPOL_0
enumeratedValue.description: The PCSx is active low.

enumeratedValue.name: PCSPOL_1
enumeratedValue.description: The PCSx is active high.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCFG_0
enumeratedValue.description: Match disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCFG_2
enumeratedValue.description: Match enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1).

enumeratedValue.name: MATCFG_3
enumeratedValue.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1).

enumeratedValue.name: MATCFG_4
enumeratedValue.description: Match enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 AND 2nd data word equals MATCH1).

enumeratedValue.name: MATCFG_5
enumeratedValue.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 AND next data word equals MATCH1)

enumeratedValue.name: MATCFG_6
enumeratedValue.description: Match enabled (1st data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1)

enumeratedValue.name: MATCFG_7
enumeratedValue.description: Match enabled (any data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1).

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_0
enumeratedValue.description: SIN is used for input data and SOUT for output data.

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_1
enumeratedValue.description: SIN is used for both input and output data.

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_2
enumeratedValue.description: SOUT is used for both input and output data.

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_3
enumeratedValue.description: SOUT is used for input data and SIN for output data.

enumeratedValue.name: OUTCFG_0
enumeratedValue.description: Output data retains last value when chip select is negated.

enumeratedValue.name: OUTCFG_1
enumeratedValue.description: Output data is tristated when chip select is negated.

enumeratedValue.name: PCSCFG_0

enumeratedValue.name: PCSCFG_1
enumeratedValue.description: PCS[3:2] are disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Sequence error not detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: ERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Sequence error detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger. ADCn block can be triggered for a conversion by one pre-trigger from PDB channel n. When one conversion, which is triggered by one of the pre-triggers from PDB channel n, is in progress, new trigger from PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger m cannot be accepted by ADCn, and ERR[m] is set. Writing 0's to clear the sequence error flags.

Writing 0's to clear the sequence error flags.

Writing 0's to clear the sequence error flags.

enumeratedValue.name: ERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Sequence error not detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: ERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Sequence error detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger. ADCn block can be triggered for a conversion by one pre-trigger from PDB channel n. When one conversion, which is triggered by one of the pre-triggers from PDB channel n, is in progress, new trigger from PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger m cannot be accepted by ADCn, and ERR[m] is set. Writing 0's to clear the sequence error flags.

enumeratedValue.name: ERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Sequence error not detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: ERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Sequence error detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger. ADCn block can be triggered for a conversion by one pre-trigger from PDB channel n. When one conversion, which is triggered by one of the pre-triggers from PDB channel n, is in progress, new trigger from PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger m cannot be accepted by ADCn, and ERR[m] is set. Writing 0's to clear the sequence error flags.

field.name: TOFDIR
field.description: Timer Overflow Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

enumeratedValue.name: TOFDIR_0
enumeratedValue.description: TOF bit was set on the bottom of counting. There was an FTM counter decrement and FTM counter changes from its minimum value (CNTIN register) to its maximum value (MOD register).

enumeratedValue.name: TOFDIR_1
enumeratedValue.description: TOF bit was set on the top of counting. There was an FTM counter increment and FTM counter changes from its maximum value (MOD register) to its minimum value (CNTIN register).

field.name: QUADIR
field.description: FTM Counter Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

enumeratedValue.name: QUADIR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Counting direction is decreasing (FTM counter decrement).

enumeratedValue.name: QUADIR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Counting direction is increasing (FTM counter increment).

enumeratedValue.name: QUADMODE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Phase A and phase B encoding mode.

enumeratedValue.name: QUADMODE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Count and direction encoding mode.

enumeratedValue.name: PHBPOL_0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal polarity. Phase B input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

enumeratedValue.name: PHBPOL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Inverted polarity. Phase B input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

enumeratedValue.name: PHAPOL_0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal polarity. Phase A input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

enumeratedValue.name: PHAPOL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Inverted polarity. Phase A input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

enumeratedValue.name: INVC_1

enumeratedValue.name: SWOC_1

enumeratedValue.name: REFSEL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Alternate reference voltage, that is, VALTH. This voltage may be additional external pin or internal source depending on the MCU configuration. See the chip configuration information for details specific to this MCU.

enumeratedValue.description: DMA is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DMAEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: DMA is enabled and will assert the ADC DMA request during an ADC conversion complete event , which is indicated when any SC1n[COCO] flag is asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: ACFE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Compare function enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ADTRG_1

enumeratedValue.name: ADACT_1

enumeratedValue.name: AVGS_3

enumeratedValue.name: AVGE_1

enumeratedValue.name: ADCO_1
enumeratedValue.description: Continuous conversions will be performed (or continuous sets of conversions, if AVGE is set) after a conversion is initiated.

enumeratedValue.name: TCR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32768 clock cycles.

enumeratedValue.name: TCR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32767 clock cycles.

enumeratedValue.name: TCR_127
enumeratedValue.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32641 clock cycles.

enumeratedValue.name: TCR_128
enumeratedValue.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32896 clock cycles.

enumeratedValue.name: TCR_255
enumeratedValue.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32769 clock cycles.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: RESET
enumeratedValue.description: Resets all RTC registers except for the SWR bit and the RTC_WAR and RTC_RAR registers . The SWR bit is cleared by POR and by software explicitly clearing it.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Wakeup pin is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Wakeup pin is enabled and wakeup pin asserts if the RTC interrupt asserts or the wakeup pin is turned on.

enumeratedValue.name: NON_SUPPORTED
enumeratedValue.description: Non-supervisor mode write accesses are not supported and generate a bus error.

enumeratedValue.name: SUPPORTED
enumeratedValue.description: Non-supervisor mode write accesses are supported.

enumeratedValue.name: PROTECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Registers cannot be written when locked.

enumeratedValue.name: WRITEABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Registers can be written when locked under limited conditions.

enumeratedValue.name: PRESCALER
enumeratedValue.description: The prescaler output clock (as configured by TSIC) is output on RTC_CLKOUT.

enumeratedValue.name: CRYSTAL
enumeratedValue.description: The RTC 32kHz crystal clock is output on RTC_CLKOUT.

enumeratedValue.name: CRYSTAL
enumeratedValue.description: RTC prescaler increments using 32 kHz crystal.

enumeratedValue.name: LPO
enumeratedValue.description: RTC prescaler increments using LPO, bits [4:0] of the prescaler are bypassed.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: 32.768 kHz oscillator is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: 32.768 kHz oscillator is enabled. After setting this bit, wait the oscillator startup time before enabling the time counter to allow the 32.768 kHz clock time to stabilize.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The 32 kHz clock is allowed to output on RTC_CLKOUT.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The 32 kHz clock is not allowed to output on RTC_CLKOUT.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: RTC_CLKOUT is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: RTC_PTE0
enumeratedValue.description: RTC_CLKOUT is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: VALID
enumeratedValue.description: Time is valid.

enumeratedValue.name: INVALID
enumeratedValue.description: Time is invalid and time counter is read as zero.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_OCCURED
enumeratedValue.description: Time overflow has not occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: OCCURED
enumeratedValue.description: Time overflow has occurred and time counter is read as zero.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_OCCURED
enumeratedValue.description: Time alarm has not occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: OCCURED
enumeratedValue.description: Time alarm has occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Time counter is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Time counter is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: Time Compensation Register is locked and writes are ignored.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValue.description: Time Compensation Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: Control Register is locked and writes are ignored.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValue.description: Control Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCKED

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValue.description: Status Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: Lock Register is locked and writes are ignored.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValue.description: Lock Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED

enumeratedValue.description: Time invalid flag does generate an interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Time overflow flag does not generate an interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Time overflow flag does generate an interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Time alarm flag does not generate an interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Time alarm flag does generate an interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Seconds interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Seconds interrupt is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: ON
enumeratedValue.description: If the wakeup pin is enabled, then the wakeup pin will assert.

field.name: DACBFRPBF
field.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Bottom Position Flag

enumeratedValue.name: DACBFRPBF_0
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC buffer read pointer is not equal to DACBFUP.

enumeratedValue.name: DACBFRPBF_1
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC buffer read pointer is equal to DACBFUP.

field.name: DACBFRPTF
field.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Top Position Flag

enumeratedValue.name: DACBFRPTF_0
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC buffer read pointer is not zero.

enumeratedValue.name: DACBFRPTF_1
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC buffer read pointer is zero.

enumeratedValue.name: DACBFWMF_0
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC buffer read pointer has not reached the watermark level.

enumeratedValue.name: DACBFWMF_1
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC buffer read pointer has reached the watermark level.

field.name: DACBBIEN
field.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Bottom Flag Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.name: DACBBIEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC buffer read pointer bottom flag interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DACBBIEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC buffer read pointer bottom flag interrupt is enabled.

field.name: DACBTIEN
field.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Top Flag Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.name: DACBTIEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC buffer read pointer top flag interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DACBTIEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC buffer read pointer top flag interrupt is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DACBWIEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC buffer watermark interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DACBWIEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC buffer watermark interrupt is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: LPEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: High-Power mode

enumeratedValue.name: LPEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Low-Power mode

enumeratedValue.name: DACSWTRG_0
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC soft trigger is not valid.

enumeratedValue.name: DACSWTRG_1
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC soft trigger is valid.

enumeratedValue.name: DACTRGSEL_0
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC hardware trigger is selected.

enumeratedValue.name: DACTRGSEL_1
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC software trigger is selected.

enumeratedValue.name: DACRFS_0
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC selects DACREF_1 as the reference voltage.

enumeratedValue.name: DACRFS_1
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC selects DACREF_2 as the reference voltage.

enumeratedValue.name: DACEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC system is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DACEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: The DAC system is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DACBFEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Buffer read pointer is disabled. The converted data is always the first word of the buffer.

enumeratedValue.name: DACBFEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Buffer read pointer is enabled. The converted data is the word that the read pointer points to. It means converted data can be from any word of the buffer.

enumeratedValue.name: DACBFMD_0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal mode

enumeratedValue.name: DACBFMD_1
enumeratedValue.description: Swing mode

enumeratedValue.name: DACBFMD_2
enumeratedValue.description: One-Time Scan mode

enumeratedValue.name: DACBFMD_3
enumeratedValue.description: FIFO mode

enumeratedValue.name: DACBFWM_0
enumeratedValue.description: In normal mode, 1 word . In FIFO mode, 2 or less than 2 data remaining in FIFO will set watermark status bit.

enumeratedValue.name: DACBFWM_1
enumeratedValue.description: In normal mode, 2 words . In FIFO mode, Max/4 or less than Max/4 data remaining in FIFO will set watermark status bit.

enumeratedValue.name: DACBFWM_2
enumeratedValue.description: In normal mode, 3 words . In FIFO mode, Max/2 or less than Max/2 data remaining in FIFO will set watermark status bit.

enumeratedValue.name: DACBFWM_3
enumeratedValue.description: In normal mode, 4 words . In FIFO mode, Max-2 or less than Max-2 data remaining in FIFO will set watermark status bit. Max is equal to the FIFO depth.

enumeratedValue.name: TESTOUTEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable DAC test output

enumeratedValue.name: TESTOUTEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable DAC test output

enumeratedValue.name: BFOUTEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable DAC output buffer

enumeratedValue.name: BFOUTEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable DAC output buffer

enumeratedValue.name: DMAEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: DMA is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DMAEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: DMA is enabled. When DMA is enabled, the DMA request will be generated by original interrupts. The interrupts will not be presented on this module at the same time.

register.name: CSR
register.description: Low Power Timer Control Status Register

enumeratedValue.name: TEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: LPTMR is disabled and internal logic is reset.

enumeratedValue.name: TEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: LPTMR is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TMS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Time Counter mode.

enumeratedValue.name: TMS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Pulse Counter mode.

enumeratedValue.name: TFC_0
enumeratedValue.description: CNR is reset whenever TCF is set.

enumeratedValue.name: TFC_1
enumeratedValue.description: CNR is reset on overflow.

enumeratedValue.name: TPP_0
enumeratedValue.description: Pulse Counter input source is active-high, and the CNR will increment on the rising-edge.

enumeratedValue.name: TPP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Pulse Counter input source is active-low, and the CNR will increment on the falling-edge.

enumeratedValue.description: Pulse counter input 0 is selected.

enumeratedValue.name: TPS_1

enumeratedValue.name: TPS_2

enumeratedValue.name: TPS_3

enumeratedValue.description: Timer interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Timer interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TCF_0
enumeratedValue.description: The value of CNR is not equal to CMR and increments.

enumeratedValue.name: TCF_1
enumeratedValue.description: The value of CNR is equal to CMR and increments.

enumeratedValue.name: TDRE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Timer DMA Request disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TDRE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Timer DMA Request enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PCS_1

enumeratedValue.name: PCS_2

enumeratedValue.name: PBYP_1

enumeratedValue.name: PRESCALE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 4; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 2 rising clock edges.

enumeratedValue.name: PRESCALE_9

enumeratedValue.name: PRESCALE_11

enumeratedValue.name: PRESCALE_12
enumeratedValue.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 8192; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 4096 rising clock edges.

enumeratedValue.name: PRESCALE_13

enumeratedValue.name: PRESCALE_14

field.name: TRACEFRAC
field.description: Trace clock divider fraction To configure TRACEDIV and TRACEFRAC, the user must clear TRACEDIVEN at first to disable the trace clock divide function.

field.name: TRACEDIV
field.description: Trace clock divider divisor To configure TRACEDIV, the user must disable TRACEDIVEN at first, and then enable it after setting TRACEDIV.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Debug trace divider disabled

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Debug trace divider enabled

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disables software interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Software can send an interrupt to CPU.

enumeratedValue.name: DOWN
enumeratedValue.description: Internal pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

enumeratedValue.name: UP
enumeratedValue.description: Internal pullup resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is not enabled on the corresponding pin.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Passive input filter is disabled on the corresponding pin.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Passive input filter is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input. Refer to the device data sheet for filter characteristics.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

enumeratedValue.name: ANA_DIS
enumeratedValue.description: Pin disabled (Alternative 0) (analog).

enumeratedValue.name: GPIO
enumeratedValue.description: Alternative 1 (GPIO).

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: Pin Control Register fields [15:0] are not locked.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: Pin Control Register fields [15:0] are locked and cannot be updated until the next system reset.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt Status Flag (ISF) is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DMA_RISING
enumeratedValue.description: ISF flag and DMA request on rising edge.

enumeratedValue.name: DMA_FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: ISF flag and DMA request on falling edge.

enumeratedValue.name: DMA_BOTH
enumeratedValue.description: ISF flag and DMA request on either edge.

enumeratedValue.name: INT_ZERO
enumeratedValue.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 0.

enumeratedValue.name: INT_RISING
enumeratedValue.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on rising-edge.

enumeratedValue.name: INT_FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on falling-edge.

enumeratedValue.name: INT_BOTH
enumeratedValue.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on either edge.

enumeratedValue.name: INT_ONE
enumeratedValue.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 1.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

enumeratedValue.name: DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

enumeratedValue.name: DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

enumeratedValue.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
