enumeratedValue.name: BUS
enumeratedValue.description: Digital filters are clocked by the bus clock.

enumeratedValue.name: LPO
enumeratedValue.description: Digital filters are clocked by the LPO clock.

enumeratedValue.name: STOP_0
enumeratedValue.description: Watchdog disabled in chip stop mode.

enumeratedValue.name: STOP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Watchdog enabled in chip stop mode.

enumeratedValue.name: WAIT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Watchdog disabled in chip wait mode.

enumeratedValue.name: WAIT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Watchdog enabled in chip wait mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DBG_0
enumeratedValue.description: Watchdog disabled in chip debug mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DBG_1
enumeratedValue.description: Watchdog enabled in chip debug mode.

enumeratedValue.name: TST_0
enumeratedValue.description: Watchdog test mode disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TST_1
enumeratedValue.description: Watchdog user mode enabled. (Watchdog test mode disabled.) After testing the watchdog, software should use this setting to indicate that the watchdog is functioning normally in user mode.

enumeratedValue.name: TST_2
enumeratedValue.description: Watchdog test mode enabled, only the low byte is used. CNT[CNTLOW] is compared with TOVAL[TOVALLOW].

enumeratedValue.name: TST_3
enumeratedValue.description: Watchdog test mode enabled, only the high byte is used. CNT[CNTHIGH] is compared with TOVAL[TOVALHIGH].

enumeratedValue.name: UPDATE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Updates not allowed. After the initial configuration, the watchdog cannot be later modified without forcing a reset.

enumeratedValue.name: UPDATE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Updates allowed. Software can modify the watchdog configuration registers within 128 bus clocks after performing the unlock write sequence.

enumeratedValue.name: INT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Watchdog interrupts are disabled. Watchdog resets are not delayed.

enumeratedValue.name: INT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Watchdog interrupts are enabled. Watchdog resets are delayed by 128 bus clocks from the interrupt vector fetch.

enumeratedValue.name: EN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Watchdog disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: EN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Watchdog enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: CLK_0
enumeratedValue.description: Bus clock

enumeratedValue.name: CLK_1
enumeratedValue.description: LPO clock

enumeratedValue.name: CLK_2
enumeratedValue.description: System oscillator clock (SOSC, from SCG)

enumeratedValue.name: CLK_3
enumeratedValue.description: Slow internal reference clock (SIRC, from SCG)

enumeratedValue.name: RCS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reconfiguring WDOG.

enumeratedValue.name: RCS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reconfiguration is successful.

enumeratedValue.name: ULK_0
enumeratedValue.description: WDOG is locked.

enumeratedValue.name: ULK_1
enumeratedValue.description: WDOG is unlocked.

enumeratedValue.name: PRES_0
enumeratedValue.description: 256 prescaler disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PRES_1
enumeratedValue.description: 256 prescaler enabled.

field.name: CMD32EN
field.description: Enables or disables WDOG support for 32-bit (otherwise 16-bit or 8-bit) refresh/unlock command write words

enumeratedValue.name: CMD32EN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disables support for 32-bit refresh/unlock command write words. Only 16-bit or 8-bit is supported.

enumeratedValue.name: CMD32EN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enables support for 32-bit refresh/unlock command write words. 16-bit or 8-bit is NOT supported.

enumeratedValue.name: FLG_0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: FLG_1
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: WIN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Window mode disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: WIN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Window mode enabled.

field.name: CNTLOW
field.description: Low byte of the Watchdog Counter

field.name: CNTHIGH
field.description: High byte of the Watchdog Counter

field.name: TOVALLOW
field.description: Low byte of the timeout value

field.name: TOVALHIGH
field.description: High byte of the timeout value

register.name: CS
register.description: Pulse Width Timer Control and Status Register

enumeratedValue.name: PWTOV_0
enumeratedValue.description: PWT counter no overflow.

enumeratedValue.name: PWTOV_1
enumeratedValue.description: PWT counter runs from 0xFFFF to 0x0000.

enumeratedValue.name: PWTRDY_0
enumeratedValue.description: PWT pulse width register(s) is not up-to-date.

enumeratedValue.name: PWTRDY_1
enumeratedValue.description: PWT pulse width register(s) has been updated.

field.name: FCTLE
field.description: First counter load enable after enable

enumeratedValue.name: FCTLE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Do not load the first counter values to corresponding registers

enumeratedValue.name: FCTLE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Load the first coutner value to corresponding registers depended by the PWTIN level

enumeratedValue.name: PWTSR_0
enumeratedValue.description: No action taken.

enumeratedValue.name: PWTSR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Writing 1 to this field will perform soft reset to PWT.

enumeratedValue.name: POVIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTOV is set.

enumeratedValue.name: POVIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTOV is set.

field.name: PRDYIE
field.description: PWT Pulse Width Data Ready Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.name: PRDYIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTRDY is set.

enumeratedValue.name: PRDYIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTRDY is set.

enumeratedValue.name: PWTIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disables the PWT to generate interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: PWTIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enables the PWT to generate interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: PWTEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: The PWT is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PWTEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: The PWT is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PRE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Clock divided by 1.

enumeratedValue.name: PRE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Clock divided by 2.

enumeratedValue.name: PRE_2
enumeratedValue.description: Clock divided by 4.

enumeratedValue.name: PRE_3
enumeratedValue.description: Clock divided by 8.

enumeratedValue.name: PRE_4
enumeratedValue.description: Clock divided by 16.

enumeratedValue.name: PRE_5
enumeratedValue.description: Clock divided by 32.

enumeratedValue.name: PRE_6
enumeratedValue.description: Clock divided by 64.

enumeratedValue.name: PRE_7
enumeratedValue.description: Clock divided by 128.

field.name: TGL
field.description: PWTIN states Toggled from last state

enumeratedValue.name: TGL_0
enumeratedValue.description: The selected PWTIN hasn't changed its original states from last time.

enumeratedValue.name: TGL_1
enumeratedValue.description: The selected PWTIN has toggled its states.

enumeratedValue.name: PINSEL_0
enumeratedValue.description: PWTIN[0] is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PINSEL_1
enumeratedValue.description: PWTIN[1] is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PINSEL_2
enumeratedValue.description: PWTIN[2] enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PINSEL_3
enumeratedValue.description: PWTIN[3] enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PCLKS_0
enumeratedValue.description: BUS_CLK is selected as the clock source of PWT counter.

enumeratedValue.name: PCLKS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Alternative clock is selected as the clock source of PWT counter.

register.name: PPH
register.description: Pulse Width Timer Positive Pulse Width Register: High

register.name: PPL
register.description: Pulse Width Timer Positive Pulse Width Register: Loq

register.name: NPH
register.description: Pulse Width Timer Negative Pulse Width Register: High

register.name: NPL
register.description: Pulse Width Timer Negative Pulse Width Register: Low

register.name: CNTH
register.description: Pulse Width Timer Counter Register: High

register.name: CNTL
register.description: Pulse Width Timer Counter Register: Low

peripheral.name: FLEXIO
peripheral.description: Flexible I/O - universal I/O module for communication (UART, SPI, I2C, I2S) and PWM purposes.

enumeratedValue.name: FEATURE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Standard features implemented.

enumeratedValue.name: FEATURE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Supports state, logic and parallel modes.

enumeratedValue.name: FLEXEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: FlexIO module is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: FLEXEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: FlexIO module is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: SWRST_0
enumeratedValue.description: Software reset is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: SWRST_1
enumeratedValue.description: Software reset is enabled, all FlexIO registers except the Control Register are reset.

enumeratedValue.name: FASTACC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Configures for normal register accesses to FlexIO

enumeratedValue.name: FASTACC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Configures for fast register accesses to FlexIO

enumeratedValue.name: DBGE_0
enumeratedValue.description: FlexIO is disabled in debug modes.

enumeratedValue.name: DBGE_1
enumeratedValue.description: FlexIO is enabled in debug modes

enumeratedValue.name: DOZEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: FlexIO enabled in Doze modes.

enumeratedValue.name: DOZEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: FlexIO disabled in Doze modes.

enumeratedValue.name: SSF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Status flag is clear

enumeratedValue.name: SSF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Status flag is set

enumeratedValue.name: SEF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter Error Flag is clear

enumeratedValue.name: SEF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter Error Flag is set

enumeratedValue.name: TSF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Status Flag is clear

enumeratedValue.name: TSF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Status Flag is set

enumeratedValue.name: SSIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter Status Flag interrupt disabled

enumeratedValue.name: SSIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter Status Flag interrupt enabled

enumeratedValue.name: SEIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter Error Flag interrupt disabled

enumeratedValue.name: SEIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter Error Flag interrupt enabled

enumeratedValue.name: TEIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Status Flag interrupt is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: TEIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Status Flag interrupt is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: SSDE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter Status Flag DMA request is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: SSDE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter Status Flag DMA request is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: SMOD_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: SMOD_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive mode. Captures the current Shifter content into the SHIFTBUF on expiration of the Timer.

enumeratedValue.name: SMOD_2
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit mode. Load SHIFTBUF contents into the Shifter on expiration of the Timer.

enumeratedValue.name: SMOD_4
enumeratedValue.description: Match Store mode. Shifter data is compared to SHIFTBUF content on expiration of the Timer.

enumeratedValue.name: SMOD_5
enumeratedValue.description: Match Continuous mode. Shifter data is continuously compared to SHIFTBUF contents.

enumeratedValue.name: PINPOL_0
enumeratedValue.description: Pin is active high

enumeratedValue.name: PINPOL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Pin is active low

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_0
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter pin output disabled

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_1
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter pin open drain or bidirectional output enable

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_2
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter pin bidirectional output data

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_3
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter pin output

enumeratedValue.name: TIMPOL_0
enumeratedValue.description: Shift on posedge of Shift clock

enumeratedValue.name: TIMPOL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Shift on negedge of Shift clock

enumeratedValue.name: SSTART_0
enumeratedValue.description: Start bit disabled for transmitter/receiver/match store, transmitter loads data on enable

enumeratedValue.name: SSTART_1
enumeratedValue.description: Start bit disabled for transmitter/receiver/match store, transmitter loads data on first shift

enumeratedValue.name: SSTART_2
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter outputs start bit value 0 before loading data on first shift, receiver/match store sets error flag if start bit is not 0

enumeratedValue.name: SSTART_3
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter outputs start bit value 1 before loading data on first shift, receiver/match store sets error flag if start bit is not 1

enumeratedValue.name: SSTOP_0
enumeratedValue.description: Stop bit disabled for transmitter/receiver/match store

enumeratedValue.name: SSTOP_2
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter outputs stop bit value 0 on store, receiver/match store sets error flag if stop bit is not 0

enumeratedValue.name: SSTOP_3
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter outputs stop bit value 1 on store, receiver/match store sets error flag if stop bit is not 1

enumeratedValue.name: INSRC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Pin

enumeratedValue.name: INSRC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter N+1 Output

register.name: SHIFTBUFBIS%s
register.description: Shifter Buffer N Bit Swapped Register

register.name: SHIFTBUFBYS%s
register.description: Shifter Buffer N Byte Swapped Register

register.name: SHIFTBUFBBS%s
register.description: Shifter Buffer N Bit Byte Swapped Register

enumeratedValue.name: TIMOD_0
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMOD_1
enumeratedValue.description: Dual 8-bit counters baud/bit mode.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMOD_2
enumeratedValue.description: Dual 8-bit counters PWM mode.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMOD_3
enumeratedValue.description: Single 16-bit counter mode.

enumeratedValue.name: PINPOL_0
enumeratedValue.description: Pin is active high

enumeratedValue.name: PINPOL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Pin is active low

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_0
enumeratedValue.description: Timer pin output disabled

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_1
enumeratedValue.description: Timer pin open drain or bidirectional output enable

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_2
enumeratedValue.description: Timer pin bidirectional output data

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_3
enumeratedValue.description: Timer pin output

enumeratedValue.name: TRGSRC_0
enumeratedValue.description: External trigger selected

enumeratedValue.name: TRGSRC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Internal trigger selected

enumeratedValue.name: TRGPOL_0
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger active high

enumeratedValue.name: TRGPOL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger active low

enumeratedValue.name: TSTART_0
enumeratedValue.description: Start bit disabled

enumeratedValue.name: TSTART_1
enumeratedValue.description: Start bit enabled

enumeratedValue.name: TSTOP_0
enumeratedValue.description: Stop bit disabled

enumeratedValue.name: TSTOP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Stop bit is enabled on timer compare

enumeratedValue.name: TSTOP_2
enumeratedValue.description: Stop bit is enabled on timer disable

enumeratedValue.name: TSTOP_3
enumeratedValue.description: Stop bit is enabled on timer compare and timer disable

enumeratedValue.name: TIMENA_0
enumeratedValue.description: Timer always enabled

enumeratedValue.name: TIMENA_1
enumeratedValue.description: Timer enabled on Timer N-1 enable

enumeratedValue.name: TIMENA_2
enumeratedValue.description: Timer enabled on Trigger high

enumeratedValue.name: TIMENA_3
enumeratedValue.description: Timer enabled on Trigger high and Pin high

enumeratedValue.name: TIMENA_4
enumeratedValue.description: Timer enabled on Pin rising edge

enumeratedValue.name: TIMENA_5
enumeratedValue.description: Timer enabled on Pin rising edge and Trigger high

enumeratedValue.name: TIMENA_6
enumeratedValue.description: Timer enabled on Trigger rising edge

enumeratedValue.name: TIMENA_7
enumeratedValue.description: Timer enabled on Trigger rising or falling edge

enumeratedValue.name: TIMDIS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Timer never disabled

enumeratedValue.name: TIMDIS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Timer disabled on Timer N-1 disable

enumeratedValue.name: TIMDIS_2
enumeratedValue.description: Timer disabled on Timer compare

enumeratedValue.name: TIMDIS_3
enumeratedValue.description: Timer disabled on Timer compare and Trigger Low

enumeratedValue.name: TIMDIS_4
enumeratedValue.description: Timer disabled on Pin rising or falling edge

enumeratedValue.name: TIMDIS_5
enumeratedValue.description: Timer disabled on Pin rising or falling edge provided Trigger is high

enumeratedValue.name: TIMDIS_6
enumeratedValue.description: Timer disabled on Trigger falling edge

enumeratedValue.name: TIMRST_0
enumeratedValue.description: Timer never reset

enumeratedValue.name: TIMRST_2
enumeratedValue.description: Timer reset on Timer Pin equal to Timer Output

enumeratedValue.name: TIMRST_3
enumeratedValue.description: Timer reset on Timer Trigger equal to Timer Output

enumeratedValue.name: TIMRST_4
enumeratedValue.description: Timer reset on Timer Pin rising edge

enumeratedValue.name: TIMRST_6
enumeratedValue.description: Timer reset on Trigger rising edge

enumeratedValue.name: TIMRST_7
enumeratedValue.description: Timer reset on Trigger rising or falling edge

enumeratedValue.name: TIMDEC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Decrement counter on FlexIO clock, Shift clock equals Timer output.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMDEC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Decrement counter on Trigger input (both edges), Shift clock equals Timer output.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMDEC_2
enumeratedValue.description: Decrement counter on Pin input (both edges), Shift clock equals Pin input.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMDEC_3
enumeratedValue.description: Decrement counter on Trigger input (both edges), Shift clock equals Trigger input.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMOUT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Timer output is logic one when enabled and is not affected by timer reset

enumeratedValue.name: TIMOUT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Timer output is logic zero when enabled and is not affected by timer reset

enumeratedValue.name: TIMOUT_2
enumeratedValue.description: Timer output is logic one when enabled and on timer reset

enumeratedValue.name: TIMOUT_3
enumeratedValue.description: Timer output is logic zero when enabled and on timer reset

field.name: ROSCEREFS
field.description: RTC 32k Oscillator external reference clcok selection

enumeratedValue.name: EXTERNAL
enumeratedValue.description: Bypass mode. RTC oscillator selects the external 32k clock.

enumeratedValue.name: CRYSTAL
enumeratedValue.description: Crystal mode.

enumeratedValue.name: STABLE
enumeratedValue.description: RTC 32k oscillator is unstable now and no clock will go out of the block.

enumeratedValue.name: UNSTABLE
enumeratedValue.description: RTC 32k oscillator is stable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Oscillator is disabled regardless the state of ROSCEN.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Oscillator is enabled in Stop mode when ROSCEN is set.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Oscillator is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Oscillator is enabled.

field.name: SERVICE
field.description: The EWM refresh mechanism requires the CPU to write two values to the SERV register: a first data byte of 0xB4, followed by a second data byte of 0x2C

field.name: COMPAREL
field.description: To prevent runaway code from changing this field, software should write to this field after a CPU reset even if the (default) minimum refresh time is required

field.name: COMPAREH
field.description: To prevent runaway code from changing this field, software should write to this field after a CPU reset even if the (default) maximum refresh time is required

field.name: CLK_DIV
field.description: Selected low power clock source for running the EWM counter can be prescaled as below

enumeratedValue.description: Error not detected with the Fast IRC trimming.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTOSTOP_1

field.name: IGNACK
field.description: When set, the received NACK field is ignored and assumed to be ACK

enumeratedValue.name: IGNACK_0
enumeratedValue.description: LPI2C Master will receive ACK and NACK normally.

enumeratedValue.name: IGNACK_1
enumeratedValue.description: LPI2C Master will treat a received NACK as if it was an ACK.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMECFG_0
enumeratedValue.description: Pin Low Timeout Flag will set if SCL is low for longer than the configured timeout.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMECFG_1
enumeratedValue.description: Pin Low Timeout Flag will set if either SCL or SDA is low for longer than the configured timeout.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCFG_0
enumeratedValue.description: Match disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCFG_2
enumeratedValue.description: Match enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1).

enumeratedValue.name: MATCFG_3
enumeratedValue.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1).

enumeratedValue.name: MATCFG_4
enumeratedValue.description: Match enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 AND 2nd data word equals MATCH1).

enumeratedValue.name: MATCFG_5
enumeratedValue.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 AND next data word equals MATCH1).

enumeratedValue.name: MATCFG_6
enumeratedValue.description: Match enabled (1st data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1).

enumeratedValue.name: MATCFG_7
enumeratedValue.description: Match enabled (any data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1).

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_0
enumeratedValue.description: LPI2C configured for 2-pin open drain mode.

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_1
enumeratedValue.description: LPI2C configured for 2-pin output only mode (ultra-fast mode).

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_2
enumeratedValue.description: LPI2C configured for 2-pin push-pull mode.

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_3
enumeratedValue.description: LPI2C configured for 4-pin push-pull mode.

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_4
enumeratedValue.description: LPI2C configured for 2-pin open drain mode with separate LPI2C slave.

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_5
enumeratedValue.description: LPI2C configured for 2-pin output only mode (ultra-fast mode) with separate LPI2C slave.

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_6
enumeratedValue.description: LPI2C configured for 2-pin push-pull mode with separate LPI2C slave.

enumeratedValue.name: PINCFG_7
enumeratedValue.description: LPI2C configured for 4-pin push-pull mode (inverted outputs).

enumeratedValue.name: CMD_0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit DATA[7:0].

enumeratedValue.name: CMD_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive (DATA[7:0] + 1) bytes.

enumeratedValue.name: CMD_2
enumeratedValue.description: Generate STOP condition.

enumeratedValue.name: CMD_3
enumeratedValue.description: Receive and discard (DATA[7:0] + 1) bytes.

enumeratedValue.name: CMD_4
enumeratedValue.description: Generate (repeated) START and transmit address in DATA[7:0].

enumeratedValue.name: CMD_5
enumeratedValue.description: Generate (repeated) START and transmit address in DATA[7:0]. This transfer expects a NACK to be returned.

enumeratedValue.name: CMD_6
enumeratedValue.description: Generate (repeated) START and transmit address in DATA[7:0] using high speed mode.

enumeratedValue.name: CMD_7
enumeratedValue.description: Generate (repeated) START and transmit address in DATA[7:0] using high speed mode. This transfer expects a NACK to be returned.

enumeratedValue.name: RXCFG_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reading the receive data register will return receive data and clear the receive data flag.

enumeratedValue.name: RXCFG_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reading the receive data register when the address valid flag is set will return the address status register and clear the address valid flag. Reading the receive data register when the address valid flag is clear will return receive data and clear the receive data flag.

field.name: RXEDGIE
field.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.name: RXEDGIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] disabled (use polling).

enumeratedValue.name: RXEDGIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] flag is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: LBKDIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] disabled (use polling).

enumeratedValue.name: LBKDIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] flag is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: RESYNCDIS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Resynchronization during received data word is supported

enumeratedValue.name: RESYNCDIS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Resynchronization during received data word is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: BOTHEDGE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock.

enumeratedValue.name: BOTHEDGE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock.

enumeratedValue.description: Noise detected in the received character in LPUART_DATA.

enumeratedValue.name: OR_0
enumeratedValue.description: No overrun.

enumeratedValue.name: OR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive overrun (new LPUART data lost).

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE_0
enumeratedValue.description: No idle line detected.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Idle line was detected.

enumeratedValue.name: RDRF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Receive data buffer empty.

enumeratedValue.name: RDRF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive data buffer full.

enumeratedValue.name: TC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).

enumeratedValue.name: TC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter idle (transmission activity complete).

enumeratedValue.name: TDRE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit data buffer full.

enumeratedValue.name: TDRE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit data buffer empty.

enumeratedValue.name: RAF_0
enumeratedValue.description: LPUART receiver idle waiting for a start bit.

enumeratedValue.name: RAF_1
enumeratedValue.description: LPUART receiver active (RXD input not idle).

enumeratedValue.name: LBKDE_0
enumeratedValue.description: LIN break detect is disabled, normal break character can be detected.

enumeratedValue.name: LBKDE_1
enumeratedValue.description: LIN break detect is enabled. LIN break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0) or 12 (if M = 1) or 13 (M10 = 1).

enumeratedValue.name: BRK13_0
enumeratedValue.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 9 to 13 bit times.

enumeratedValue.name: BRK13_1
enumeratedValue.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 12 to 15 bit times.

enumeratedValue.name: RWUID_0
enumeratedValue.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not get set when an address does not match.

enumeratedValue.name: RWUID_1
enumeratedValue.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does get set when an address does not match.

enumeratedValue.name: RXINV_0
enumeratedValue.description: Receive data not inverted.

enumeratedValue.name: RXINV_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive data inverted.

enumeratedValue.name: MSBF_0
enumeratedValue.description: LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

enumeratedValue.name: MSBF_1
enumeratedValue.description: MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of CTRL[M] and CTRL[PE].

field.name: RXEDGIF
field.description: RXD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

enumeratedValue.name: RXEDGIF_0
enumeratedValue.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: RXEDGIF_1
enumeratedValue.description: An active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: LBKDIF_0
enumeratedValue.description: No LIN break character has been detected.

enumeratedValue.name: LBKDIF_1
enumeratedValue.description: LIN break character has been detected.

enumeratedValue.name: PT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Even parity.

enumeratedValue.name: PT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Odd parity.

enumeratedValue.name: PE_0
enumeratedValue.description: No hardware parity generation or checking.

enumeratedValue.name: PE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Parity enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ILT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Idle character bit count starts after start bit.

enumeratedValue.name: ILT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Idle character bit count starts after stop bit.

enumeratedValue.name: WAKE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Configures RWU for idle-line wakeup.

enumeratedValue.name: WAKE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Configures RWU with address-mark wakeup.

enumeratedValue.name: M_0
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit data characters.

enumeratedValue.name: M_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver and transmitter use 9-bit data characters.

enumeratedValue.name: RSRC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Provided LOOPS is set, RSRC is cleared, selects internal loop back mode and the LPUART does not use the RXD pin.

enumeratedValue.name: RSRC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Single-wire LPUART mode where the TXD pin is connected to the transmitter output and receiver input.

enumeratedValue.name: DOZEEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: LPUART is enabled in Doze mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DOZEEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: LPUART is disabled in Doze mode.

enumeratedValue.name: LOOPS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation - RXD and TXD use separate pins.

enumeratedValue.name: LOOPS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Loop mode or single-wire mode where transmitter outputs are internally connected to receiver input (see RSRC bit).

enumeratedValue.name: IDLECFG_0
enumeratedValue.description: 1 idle character

enumeratedValue.name: IDLECFG_1
enumeratedValue.description: 2 idle characters

enumeratedValue.name: IDLECFG_2
enumeratedValue.description: 4 idle characters

enumeratedValue.name: IDLECFG_3
enumeratedValue.description: 8 idle characters

enumeratedValue.name: IDLECFG_4
enumeratedValue.description: 16 idle characters

enumeratedValue.name: IDLECFG_5
enumeratedValue.description: 32 idle characters

enumeratedValue.name: IDLECFG_6
enumeratedValue.description: 64 idle characters

enumeratedValue.name: IDLECFG_7
enumeratedValue.description: 128 idle characters

enumeratedValue.name: M7_0
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit to 10-bit data characters.

enumeratedValue.name: M7_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit data characters.

enumeratedValue.name: MA2IE_0
enumeratedValue.description: MA2F interrupt disabled

enumeratedValue.name: MA2IE_1
enumeratedValue.description: MA2F interrupt enabled

enumeratedValue.name: MA1IE_0
enumeratedValue.description: MA1F interrupt disabled

enumeratedValue.name: MA1IE_1
enumeratedValue.description: MA1F interrupt enabled

enumeratedValue.name: SBK_0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal transmitter operation.

enumeratedValue.name: SBK_1
enumeratedValue.description: Queue break character(s) to be sent.

enumeratedValue.name: RWU_0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal receiver operation.

enumeratedValue.name: RWU_1
enumeratedValue.description: LPUART receiver in standby waiting for wakeup condition.

enumeratedValue.name: RE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: RE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ILIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupts from IDLE disabled; use polling.

enumeratedValue.name: ILIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when IDLE flag is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: RIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupts from RDRF disabled; use polling.

enumeratedValue.name: RIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when RDRF flag is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: TCIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupts from TC disabled; use polling.

enumeratedValue.name: TCIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TC flag is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: TIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupts from TDRE disabled; use polling.

enumeratedValue.name: TIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TDRE flag is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: PEIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: PF interrupts disabled; use polling).

enumeratedValue.name: PEIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when PF is set.

enumeratedValue.name: FEIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: FE interrupts disabled; use polling.

enumeratedValue.name: FEIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when FE is set.

enumeratedValue.name: NEIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: NF interrupts disabled; use polling.

enumeratedValue.name: NEIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when NF is set.

enumeratedValue.name: ORIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: OR interrupts disabled; use polling.

enumeratedValue.name: ORIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when OR is set.

enumeratedValue.name: TXINV_0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit data not inverted.

enumeratedValue.name: TXINV_1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit data inverted.

field.name: TXDIR
field.description: TXD Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

enumeratedValue.name: TXDIR_0
enumeratedValue.description: TXD pin is an input in single-wire mode.

enumeratedValue.name: TXDIR_1
enumeratedValue.description: TXD pin is an output in single-wire mode.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLINE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver was not idle before receiving this character.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLINE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver was idle before receiving this character.

enumeratedValue.name: RXEMPT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Receive buffer contains valid data.

enumeratedValue.name: RXEMPT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive buffer is empty, data returned on read is not valid.

enumeratedValue.name: FRETSC_0
enumeratedValue.description: The dataword was received without a frame error on read, transmit a normal character on write.

enumeratedValue.name: FRETSC_1
enumeratedValue.description: The dataword was received with a frame error, transmit an idle or break character on transmit.

enumeratedValue.name: PARITYE_0
enumeratedValue.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.

enumeratedValue.name: PARITYE_1
enumeratedValue.description: The dataword was received with a parity error.

enumeratedValue.name: NOISY_0
enumeratedValue.description: The dataword was received without noise.

enumeratedValue.name: NOISY_1
enumeratedValue.description: The data was received with noise.

enumeratedValue.name: TXCTSE_0
enumeratedValue.description: CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

enumeratedValue.name: TXCTSE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.

enumeratedValue.name: TXRTSE_0
enumeratedValue.description: The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

enumeratedValue.name: TXRTSE_1
enumeratedValue.description: When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.

enumeratedValue.name: TXRTSPOL_0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter RTS is active low.

enumeratedValue.name: TXRTSPOL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter RTS is active high.

enumeratedValue.name: RXRTSE_0
enumeratedValue.description: The receiver has no effect on RTS.

enumeratedValue.name: RXRTSE_1
enumeratedValue.description: no description available

enumeratedValue.name: TXCTSC_0
enumeratedValue.description: CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.

enumeratedValue.name: TXCTSC_1
enumeratedValue.description: CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.

enumeratedValue.name: TXCTSSRC_0
enumeratedValue.description: CTS input is the CTS_B pin.

enumeratedValue.name: TXCTSSRC_1
enumeratedValue.description: CTS input is the inverted Receiver Match result.

enumeratedValue.name: TNP_0
enumeratedValue.description: 1/OSR.

enumeratedValue.name: TNP_1
enumeratedValue.description: 2/OSR.

enumeratedValue.name: TNP_2
enumeratedValue.description: 3/OSR.

enumeratedValue.name: TNP_3
enumeratedValue.description: 4/OSR.

enumeratedValue.name: IREN_0
enumeratedValue.description: IR disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: IREN_1
enumeratedValue.description: IR enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: RXFIFOSIZE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

enumeratedValue.name: RXFIFOSIZE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

enumeratedValue.name: RXFIFOSIZE_2
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

enumeratedValue.name: RXFIFOSIZE_3
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

enumeratedValue.name: RXFIFOSIZE_4
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

enumeratedValue.name: RXFIFOSIZE_5
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

enumeratedValue.name: RXFIFOSIZE_6
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

enumeratedValue.name: RXFIFOSIZE_7
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords.

enumeratedValue.name: RXFE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support)

enumeratedValue.name: RXFE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.

enumeratedValue.name: TXFIFOSIZE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

enumeratedValue.name: TXFIFOSIZE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

enumeratedValue.name: TXFIFOSIZE_2
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

enumeratedValue.name: TXFIFOSIZE_3
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

enumeratedValue.name: TXFIFOSIZE_4
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

enumeratedValue.name: TXFIFOSIZE_5
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

enumeratedValue.name: TXFIFOSIZE_6
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

enumeratedValue.name: TXFIFOSIZE_7
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords

enumeratedValue.name: TXFE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support).

enumeratedValue.name: TXFE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.

enumeratedValue.name: RXUFE_0
enumeratedValue.description: RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

enumeratedValue.name: RXUFE_1
enumeratedValue.description: RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

enumeratedValue.name: TXOFE_0
enumeratedValue.description: TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

enumeratedValue.name: TXOFE_1
enumeratedValue.description: TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

enumeratedValue.name: RXIDEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.

enumeratedValue.name: RXIDEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 1 character.

enumeratedValue.name: RXIDEN_2
enumeratedValue.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 2 characters.

enumeratedValue.name: RXIDEN_3
enumeratedValue.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 4 characters.

enumeratedValue.name: RXIDEN_4
enumeratedValue.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 8 characters.

enumeratedValue.name: RXIDEN_5
enumeratedValue.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 16 characters.

enumeratedValue.name: RXIDEN_6
enumeratedValue.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 32 characters.

enumeratedValue.name: RXIDEN_7
enumeratedValue.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 64 characters.

enumeratedValue.name: RXFLUSH_0
enumeratedValue.description: No flush operation occurs.

enumeratedValue.name: RXFLUSH_1
enumeratedValue.description: All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.

enumeratedValue.name: TXFLUSH_0
enumeratedValue.description: No flush operation occurs.

enumeratedValue.name: TXFLUSH_1
enumeratedValue.description: All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.

enumeratedValue.name: RXUF_0
enumeratedValue.description: No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: RXUF_1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: TXOF_0
enumeratedValue.description: No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: TXOF_1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: RXEMPT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Receive buffer is not empty.

enumeratedValue.name: RXEMPT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive buffer is empty.

enumeratedValue.name: TXEMPT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit buffer is not empty.

enumeratedValue.name: TXEMPT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit buffer is empty.

peripheral.name: CMP0
peripheral.description: High-Speed Comparator (CMP), Voltage Reference (VREF) Digital-to-Analog Converter (DAC), and Analog Mux (ANMUX)

field.name: HYSTCTR
field.description: Comparator hard block hysteresis control. See chip data sheet to get the actual hystersis value with each level

enumeratedValue.name: HYSTCTR_0
enumeratedValue.description: The hard block output has level 0 hysteresis internally.

enumeratedValue.name: HYSTCTR_1
enumeratedValue.description: The hard block output has level 1 hysteresis internally.

enumeratedValue.name: HYSTCTR_2
enumeratedValue.description: The hard block output has level 2 hysteresis internally.

enumeratedValue.name: HYSTCTR_3
enumeratedValue.description: The hard block output has level 3 hysteresis internally.

field.name: OFFSET
field.description: Comparator hard block offset control. See chip data sheet to get the actual offset value with each level

enumeratedValue.name: OFFSET_0
enumeratedValue.description: The comparator hard block output has level 0 offset internally.

enumeratedValue.name: OFFSET_1
enumeratedValue.description: The comparator hard block output has level 1 offset internally.

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_CNT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Filter is disabled. If SE = 1, then COUT is a logic zero (this is not a legal state, and is not recommended). If SE = 0, COUT = COUTA.

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_CNT_1
enumeratedValue.description: 1 consecutive sample must agree (comparator output is simply sampled).

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_CNT_2
enumeratedValue.description: 2 consecutive samples must agree.

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_CNT_3
enumeratedValue.description: 3 consecutive samples must agree.

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_CNT_4
enumeratedValue.description: 4 consecutive samples must agree.

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_CNT_5
enumeratedValue.description: 5 consecutive samples must agree.

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_CNT_6
enumeratedValue.description: 6 consecutive samples must agree.

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_CNT_7
enumeratedValue.description: 7 consecutive samples must agree.

enumeratedValue.name: EN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Analog Comparator is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: EN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Analog Comparator is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: OPE_0
enumeratedValue.description: When OPE is 0, the comparator output (after window/filter settings dependent on software configuration) is not available to a packaged pin.

enumeratedValue.name: OPE_1
enumeratedValue.description: When OPE is 1, and if the software has configured the comparator to own a packaged pin, the comparator is available in a packaged pin.

enumeratedValue.name: COS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Set CMPO to equal COUT (filtered comparator output).

enumeratedValue.name: COS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Set CMPO to equal COUTA (unfiltered comparator output).

enumeratedValue.name: INVT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Does not invert the comparator output.

enumeratedValue.name: INVT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Inverts the comparator output.

enumeratedValue.name: PMODE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Low Speed (LS) comparison mode is selected.

enumeratedValue.name: PMODE_1
enumeratedValue.description: High Speed (HS) comparison mode is selected, in VLPx mode, or Stop mode switched to Low Speed (LS) mode.

enumeratedValue.name: WE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Windowing mode is not selected.

enumeratedValue.name: WE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Windowing mode is selected.

enumeratedValue.name: SE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Sampling mode is not selected.

enumeratedValue.name: SE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Sampling mode is selected.

enumeratedValue.name: CFF_0
enumeratedValue.description: A falling edge has not been detected on COUT.

enumeratedValue.name: CFF_1
enumeratedValue.description: A falling edge on COUT has occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: CFR_0
enumeratedValue.description: A rising edge has not been detected on COUT.

enumeratedValue.name: CFR_1
enumeratedValue.description: A rising edge on COUT has occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: IEF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: IEF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: IER_0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: IER_1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DMAEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: DMA is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DMAEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: DMA is enabled.

enumeratedValue.description: IN0

enumeratedValue.name: MSEL_1
enumeratedValue.description: IN1

enumeratedValue.description: IN2

enumeratedValue.description: IN3

enumeratedValue.description: IN5

enumeratedValue.description: IN6

enumeratedValue.name: MSEL_7
enumeratedValue.description: IN7

enumeratedValue.description: IN0

enumeratedValue.name: PSEL_1
enumeratedValue.description: IN1

enumeratedValue.description: IN2

enumeratedValue.name: PSEL_3
enumeratedValue.description: IN3

enumeratedValue.name: PSEL_4

enumeratedValue.name: PSEL_5

enumeratedValue.name: PSEL_6
enumeratedValue.description: IN6

enumeratedValue.name: PSEL_7

enumeratedValue.name: VRSEL_0
enumeratedValue.description: Vin1 is selected as resistor ladder network supply reference Vin.

enumeratedValue.name: VRSEL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Vin2 is selected as resistor ladder network supply reference Vin.

enumeratedValue.name: DACEN_0

enumeratedValue.name: DACEN_1

field.name: INNSEL
field.description: Selection of the input to the negative port of the comparator

enumeratedValue.name: INNSEL_0
enumeratedValue.description: IN0, from the 8-bit DAC output

enumeratedValue.name: INNSEL_1
enumeratedValue.description: IN1, from the analog 8-1 mux

field.name: INPSEL
field.description: Selection of the input to the positive port of the comparator

enumeratedValue.name: INPSEL_0
enumeratedValue.description: IN0, from the 8-bit DAC output

enumeratedValue.name: INPSEL_1
enumeratedValue.description: IN1, from the analog 8-1 mux

field.name: ACOn
field.description: The result of the input comparison for channel n

field.name: INITMOD
field.description: Comparator and DAC initialization delay modulus.

enumeratedValue.name: INITMOD_0
enumeratedValue.description: The modulus is set to 64(same with 111111).

enumeratedValue.name: NSAM_0
enumeratedValue.description: The comparison result is sampled as soon as the active channel is scanned in one round-robin clock.

enumeratedValue.name: NSAM_1
enumeratedValue.description: The sampling takes place 1 round-robin clock cycle after the next cycle of the round-robin clock.

enumeratedValue.name: NSAM_2
enumeratedValue.description: The sampling takes place 2 round-robin clock cycles after the next cycle of the round-robin clock.

enumeratedValue.name: NSAM_3
enumeratedValue.description: The sampling takes place 3 round-robin clock cycles after the next cycle of the round-robin clock.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMXCH_0
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 0 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMXCH_1
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 1 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMXCH_2
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 2 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMXCH_3
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 3 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMXCH_4
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 4 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMXCH_5
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 5 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMXCH_6
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 6 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMXCH_7
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 7 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMP_0
enumeratedValue.description: The Plus port is fixed. Only the inputs to the Minus port are swept in each round.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMP_1
enumeratedValue.description: The Minus port is fixed. Only the inputs to the Plus port are swept in each round.

enumeratedValue.name: RRIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: The round-robin interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: RRIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: The round-robin interrupt is enabled when a comparison result changes from the last sample.

enumeratedValue.name: RRE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Round-robin operation is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: RRE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Round-robin operation is enabled.

peripheral.name: CMP1

peripheral.name: CMP2

register.name: LVDSC1

enumeratedValue.name: LVDRE_0
enumeratedValue.description: No system resets on low voltage detect events.

enumeratedValue.name: LVDRE_1
enumeratedValue.description: If the supply voltage falls below VLVD, a system reset will be generated.

enumeratedValue.name: LVDIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Request a hardware interrupt when LVDF = 1

enumeratedValue.description: Low-voltage event not detected

enumeratedValue.name: LVDF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Low-voltage event detected

register.name: LVDSC2

enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt disabled (use polling)

enumeratedValue.name: LVWIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Request a hardware interrupt when LVWF=1

enumeratedValue.name: LVWF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Low-voltage warning event not detected

enumeratedValue.name: LVWF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Low-voltage warning event detected

enumeratedValue.name: BIASEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Biasing disabled, core logic can run in full performance

enumeratedValue.name: BIASEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Biasing enabled, core logic is slower and there are restrictions in allowed system clock speed (see Data Sheet for details)

enumeratedValue.name: CLKBIASDIS_0
enumeratedValue.description: No effect

enumeratedValue.name: CLKBIASDIS_1
enumeratedValue.description: In STOP or VLPS mode the bias currents and reference voltages for the following clock modules are disabled: SIRC, FIRC, PLL. (if available on device)

field.name: DISDEFWBUF

enumeratedValue.description: there are no active exceptions, or the currently-executing exception is the only active exception

field.name: VECTPENDING

enumeratedValue.name: ISRPREEMPT_1

enumeratedValue.name: PENDSTCLR_1

enumeratedValue.name: PENDSTSET_1

enumeratedValue.name: MUNSTKERR_1

enumeratedValue.name: MSTKERR_1

enumeratedValue.name: BFARVALID_0

enumeratedValue.name: BFARVALID_1
enumeratedValue.description: BFAR holds a valid fault address

enumeratedValue.name: NOCP_1

enumeratedValue.name: VECTTBL_1
enumeratedValue.description: BusFault on vector table read

enumeratedValue.name: FORCED_0
enumeratedValue.description: no forced HardFault

enumeratedValue.name: FORCED_1
enumeratedValue.description: forced HardFault

enumeratedValue.name: HALTED_0

enumeratedValue.name: HALTED_1
enumeratedValue.description: Halt request debug event active

enumeratedValue.name: BKPT_0
enumeratedValue.description: No current breakpoint debug event

enumeratedValue.name: BKPT_1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one current breakpoint debug event

enumeratedValue.name: DWTTRAP_0

enumeratedValue.name: DWTTRAP_1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one current debug event generated by the DWT

enumeratedValue.name: VCATCH_0
enumeratedValue.description: No Vector catch triggered

enumeratedValue.name: VCATCH_1
enumeratedValue.description: Vector catch triggered

enumeratedValue.name: EXTERNAL_0

enumeratedValue.name: EXTERNAL_1

field.name: AUXFAULT
field.description: Latched version of the AUXFAULT inputs

enumeratedValue.name: CP10_0
enumeratedValue.description: Access denied. Any attempted access generates a NOCP UsageFault

enumeratedValue.name: CP10_1
enumeratedValue.description: Privileged access only. An unprivileged access generates a NOCP fault.

enumeratedValue.name: CP10_3
enumeratedValue.description: Full access.

enumeratedValue.name: CP11_0
enumeratedValue.description: Access denied. Any attempted access generates a NOCP UsageFault

enumeratedValue.name: CP11_1
enumeratedValue.description: Privileged access only. An unprivileged access generates a NOCP fault.

enumeratedValue.name: CP11_3
enumeratedValue.description: Full access.

enumeratedValue.name: LSPACT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Lazy state preservation is not active.

enumeratedValue.name: LSPACT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Lazy state preservation is active. floating-point stack frame has been allocated but saving state to it has been deferred.

field.name: USER
field.description: Privilege level when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: USER_0
enumeratedValue.description: Privilege level was not user when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: USER_1
enumeratedValue.description: Privilege level was user when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

field.name: THREAD
field.description: Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: THREAD_0
enumeratedValue.description: Mode was not Thread Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: THREAD_1
enumeratedValue.description: Mode was Thread Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

field.name: HFRDY
field.description: Permission to set the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: HFRDY_0
enumeratedValue.description: Priority did not permit setting the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: HFRDY_1
enumeratedValue.description: Priority permitted setting the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

field.name: MMRDY
field.description: Permission to set the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: MMRDY_0
enumeratedValue.description: MemManage is disabled or priority did not permit setting the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: MMRDY_1
enumeratedValue.description: MemManage is enabled and priority permitted setting the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

field.name: BFRDY
field.description: Permission to set the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: BFRDY_0
enumeratedValue.description: BusFault is disabled or priority did not permit setting the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: BFRDY_1
enumeratedValue.description: BusFault is disabled or priority did not permit setting the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

field.name: MONRDY
field.description: Permission to set the MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: MONRDY_0
enumeratedValue.description: DebugMonitor is disabled or priority did not permit setting MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: MONRDY_1
enumeratedValue.description: DebugMonitor is enabled and priority permits setting MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

field.name: LSPEN
field.description: Lazy state preservation for floating-point context.

enumeratedValue.name: LSPEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable automatic lazy state preservation for floating-point context.

enumeratedValue.name: LSPEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable automatic lazy state preservation for floating-point context.

field.name: ASPEN
field.description: Enables CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction. This results in automatic hardware state preservation and restoration, for floating-point context, on exception entry and exit.

enumeratedValue.name: ASPEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction.

enumeratedValue.name: ASPEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction.

field.name: ADDRESS
field.description: The location of the unpopulated floating-point register space allocated on an exception stack frame.

field.name: RMode
field.description: Default value for FPSCR.RMode (Rounding Mode control field).

enumeratedValue.name: RMode_0
enumeratedValue.description: Round to Nearest (RN) mode

enumeratedValue.name: RMode_1
enumeratedValue.description: Round towards Plus Infinity (RP) mode.

enumeratedValue.name: RMode_2
enumeratedValue.description: Round towards Minus Infinity (RM) mode.

enumeratedValue.name: RMode_3
enumeratedValue.description: Round towards Zero (RZ) mode.

field.name: FZ
field.description: Default value for FPSCR.FZ (Flush-to-zero mode control bit).

enumeratedValue.name: FZ_0
enumeratedValue.description: Flush-to-zero mode disabled. Behavior of the floating-point system is fully compliant with the IEEE 754 standard.

enumeratedValue.name: FZ_1
enumeratedValue.description: Flush-to-zero mode enabled.

field.name: DN
field.description: Default value for FPSCR.DN (Default NaN mode control bit).

enumeratedValue.name: DN_0
enumeratedValue.description: NaN operands propagate through to the output of a floating-point operation.

enumeratedValue.name: DN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Any operation involving one or more NaNs returns the Default NaN.

field.name: AHP
field.description: Default value for FPSCR.AHP (Alternative half-precision control bit).

enumeratedValue.name: AHP_0
enumeratedValue.description: IEEE half-precision format selected.

enumeratedValue.name: AHP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Alternative half-precision format selected.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE_0
enumeratedValue.description: counter disabled

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE_1
enumeratedValue.description: counter enabled

enumeratedValue.name: TICKINT_0
enumeratedValue.description: counting down to 0 does not assert the SysTick exception request

enumeratedValue.name: TICKINT_1
enumeratedValue.description: counting down to 0 asserts the SysTick exception request

enumeratedValue.name: CLKSOURCE_0
enumeratedValue.description: external clock

enumeratedValue.name: CLKSOURCE_1
enumeratedValue.description: processor clock

field.name: RELOAD
field.description: Value to load into the SysTick Current Value Register when the counter reaches 0

field.name: CURRENT
field.description: Current value at the time the register is accessed

field.name: TENMS
field.description: Reload value to use for 10ms timing

enumeratedValue.name: SKEW_0
enumeratedValue.description: 10ms calibration value is exact

enumeratedValue.name: SKEW_1
enumeratedValue.description: 10ms calibration value is inexact, because of the clock frequency

enumeratedValue.name: NOREF_0
enumeratedValue.description: The reference clock is provided

enumeratedValue.name: NOREF_1
enumeratedValue.description: The reference clock is not provided

field.name: INTID
field.description: Interrupt ID of the interrupt to trigger, in the range 0-239. For example, a value of 0x03 specifies interrupt IRQ3.

register.name: DHCSR_Read
register.description: Debug Halting Control and Status Register

field.name: C_DEBUGEN
field.description: Halting debug enable bit. If a debugger writes to DHCSR to change the value of this bit from 0 to 1, it must also write 0 to the C_MASKINTS bit, otherwise behavior is UNPREDICTABLE.This bit can only be set to 1 from the DAP, it cannot be set to 1 under software control.This bit is 0 after a Power-on reset.

enumeratedValue.name: C_DEBUGEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled

enumeratedValue.name: C_DEBUGEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled

field.name: C_HALT
field.description: Processor halt bit. This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

enumeratedValue.name: C_HALT_0
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: C_HALT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Halt the processor.

field.name: C_STEP
field.description: Processor step bit.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

enumeratedValue.name: C_STEP_0
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: C_STEP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Step the processor.

field.name: C_MASKINTS
field.description: C_MASKINTS bit. When debug is enabled, the debugger can write to this bit to mask PendSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts. The effect of any attempt to change the value of this bit is UNPREDICTABLE unless both:- before the write to DHCSR, the value of the C_HALT bit is 1.- the write to the DHCSR that changes the C_MASKINTS bit also writes 1 to the C_HALT bit.This means that a single write to DHCSR cannot set the C_HALT to 0 and change the value of the C_MASKINTS bit.The bit does not affect NMI. When DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the value of this bit is UNKNOWN.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

enumeratedValue.name: C_MASKINTS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Do not mask.

enumeratedValue.name: C_MASKINTS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Mask PenSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts.

field.name: C_SNAPSTALL
field.description: C_SNAPSTALL bit. If the processor is stalled on a load or store operation, a debugger can set this bit to 1 to attempt to break the stall. The effect of setting this bit to 1 is UNPREDICTABLE unless the DHCSR write also sets C_DEBUGEN and C_HALT to 1.This means that if the processor is not already in Debug statea it enters Debug state when the stalled instruction completes.Writing 1 to this bit makes the state of the memory system UNPREDICTABLE. Therefore, if a debugger writes 1 to this bit it must reset the processor before leaving Debug state.A Power-on reset sets this bit to 0.

enumeratedValue.name: C_SNAPSTALL_0
enumeratedValue.description: No action.

enumeratedValue.name: C_SNAPSTALL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Attempt to force any stalled load or store instruction to complete.

field.name: S_REGRDY
field.description: S_REGRDY bit. A handshake flag for transfers through the DCRDR:- Writing to DCRSR clears the bit to 0.- Completion of the DCRDR transfer then sets the bit to 1.This bit is valid only when the processor is in Debug state, otherwise the bit is UNKNOWN.

enumeratedValue.name: S_REGRDY_0
enumeratedValue.description: There has been a write to the DCRDR, but the transfer is not complete.

enumeratedValue.name: S_REGRDY_1
enumeratedValue.description: The transfer to or from the DCRDR is complete.

field.name: S_HALT
field.description: S_HALT bit. Indicates whether the processor is in Debug state.

enumeratedValue.name: S_HALT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Not in Debug state.

enumeratedValue.name: S_HALT_1
enumeratedValue.description: In Debug state.

field.name: S_SLEEP
field.description: S_SLEEP bit. Indicates whether the processor is sleeping.The debugger must set the C_HALT bit to 1 to gain control, or wait for an interrupt or other wakeup event to wakeup the system.

enumeratedValue.name: S_SLEEP_0
enumeratedValue.description: Not sleeping.

enumeratedValue.name: S_SLEEP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Sleeping.

field.name: S_LOCKUP
field.description: S_LOCKUP bit. Indicates whether the processor is locked up because of an unrecoverable exception.This bit can only be read as 1 by a remote debugger, using the DAP. The value of 1 indicates that the processor is running but locked up.The bit clears to 0 when the processor enters Debug state.

enumeratedValue.name: S_LOCKUP_0
enumeratedValue.description: Not locked up

enumeratedValue.name: S_LOCKUP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Locked up

field.name: S_RETIRE_ST
field.description: S_RETIRE_ST bit. Indicates whether the processor has completed the execution of an instruction since the last read of DHCSR.This is a sticky bit, that clears to 0 on a read of DHCSR.A debugger can check this bit to determine if the processor is stalled on a load, store or fetch access.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on or Local reset, but then is set to 1 as soon as the processor executes and retires an instruction.

enumeratedValue.name: S_RETIRE_ST_0
enumeratedValue.description: No instruction retired since last DHCSR read.

enumeratedValue.name: S_RETIRE_ST_1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one instruction retired since last DHCSR read.

field.name: S_RESET_ST
field.description: S_RESET_ST bit. Indicates whether the processor has been reset since the last read of DHCSR.This is a sticky bit, that clears to 0 on a read of DHCSR.

enumeratedValue.name: S_RESET_ST_0
enumeratedValue.description: No reset since last DHCSR read.

enumeratedValue.name: S_RESET_ST_1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one reset since last DHCSR read.

register.name: DHCSR_Write
register.description: Debug Halting Control and Status Register

field.name: C_DEBUGEN
field.description: Halting debug enable bit. If a debugger writes to DHCSR to change the value of this bit from 0 to 1, it must also write 0 to the C_MASKINTS bit, otherwise behavior is UNPREDICTABLE.This bit can only be set to 1 from the DAP, it cannot be set to 1 under software control.This bit is 0 after a Power-on reset.

enumeratedValue.name: C_DEBUGEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled

enumeratedValue.name: C_DEBUGEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled

field.name: C_HALT
field.description: Processor halt bit. This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

enumeratedValue.name: C_HALT_0
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: C_HALT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Halt the processor.

field.name: C_STEP
field.description: Processor step bit.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

enumeratedValue.name: C_STEP_0
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: C_STEP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Step the processor.

field.name: C_MASKINTS
field.description: C_MASKINTS bit. When debug is enabled, the debugger can write to this bit to mask PendSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts. The effect of any attempt to change the value of this bit is UNPREDICTABLE unless both:- before the write to DHCSR, the value of the C_HALT bit is 1.- the write to the DHCSR that changes the C_MASKINTS bit also writes 1 to the C_HALT bit.This means that a single write to DHCSR cannot set the C_HALT to 0 and change the value of the C_MASKINTS bit.The bit does not affect NMI. When DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the value of this bit is UNKNOWN.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

enumeratedValue.name: C_MASKINTS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Do not mask.

enumeratedValue.name: C_MASKINTS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Mask PenSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts.

field.name: C_SNAPSTALL
field.description: C_SNAPSTALL bit. If the processor is stalled on a load or store operation, a debugger can set this bit to 1 to attempt to break the stall. The effect of setting this bit to 1 is UNPREDICTABLE unless the DHCSR write also sets C_DEBUGEN and C_HALT to 1.This means that if the processor is not already in Debug statea it enters Debug state when the stalled instruction completes.Writing 1 to this bit makes the state of the memory system UNPREDICTABLE. Therefore, if a debugger writes 1 to this bit it must reset the processor before leaving Debug state.A Power-on reset sets this bit to 0.

enumeratedValue.name: C_SNAPSTALL_0
enumeratedValue.description: No action.

enumeratedValue.name: C_SNAPSTALL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Attempt to force any stalled load or store instruction to complete.

field.name: DBGKEY
field.description: Debug key:Software must write 0xA05F to this field to enable write accesses to bits [15:0], otherwise the processor ignores the write access.

field.name: REGSEL
field.description: REGSEL bits. Specifies the ARM core register, special-purpose register, or Floating-point extension register, to transfer.

field.name: REGWnR
field.description: REGWnR bit. Specifies the access type for the transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: REGWnR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Read

enumeratedValue.name: REGWnR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Write

field.name: DBGTMP
field.description: DBGTMP bits. Data temporary cache, for reading and writing the ARM core registers, special-purpose registers, and Floating-point extension registers.The value of this register is UNKNOWN:- on reset- if the processor is in Debug state, the debugger has written to DCRSR since entering Debug state and DHCSR.S_REGRDY is set to 0.

register.name: DEMCR
register.description: Debug Exception and Monitor Control Register

field.name: VC_CORERESET
field.description: VC_CORERESET bit. Enable Reset Vector Catch. This causes a Local reset to halt a running system.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_CORERESET_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset Vector Catch disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_CORERESET_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset Vector Catch enabled.

field.name: VC_MMERR
field.description: VC_MMERR bit. Enable halting debug trap on a MemManage exception.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_MMERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Halting debug trap disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_MMERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Halting debug trap enabled.

field.name: VC_NOCPERR
field.description: VC_NOCPERR bit. Enable halting debug trap on a UsageFault caused by an access to a Coprocessor.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_NOCPERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Halting debug trap disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_NOCPERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Halting debug trap enabled.

field.name: VC_CHKERR
field.description: VC_CHKERR bit. Enable halting debug trap on a UsageFault exception caused by a checking error, for example an alignment check error.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_CHKERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Halting debug trap disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_CHKERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Halting debug trap enabled.

field.name: VC_STATERR
field.description: VC_STATERR bit. Enable halting debug trap on a UsageFault exception caused by a state information error, for example an Undefined Instruction exception.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_STATERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Halting debug trap disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_STATERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Halting debug trap enabled.

field.name: VC_BUSERR
field.description: VC_BUSERR bit. Enable halting debug trap on a BusFault exception.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_BUSERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Halting debug trap disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_BUSERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Halting debug trap enabled.

field.name: VC_INTERR
field.description: VC_INTERR bit. Enable halting debug trap on a fault occurring during exception entry or exception return.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_INTERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Halting debug trap disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_INTERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Halting debug trap enabled.

field.name: VC_HARDERR
field.description: VC_HARDERR bit. Enable halting debug trap on a HardFault exception.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_HARDERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Halting debug trap disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_HARDERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Halting debug trap enabled.

field.name: MON_EN
field.description: MON_EN bit. Enable the DebugMonitor exception.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 1, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: MON_EN_0
enumeratedValue.description: DebugMonitor exception disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: MON_EN_1
enumeratedValue.description: DebugMonitor exception enabled.

field.name: MON_PEND
field.description: MON_PEND bit. Sets or clears the pending state of the DebugMonitor exception.When the DebugMonitor exception is pending it becomes active subject to the exception priority rules. A debugger can use this bit to wakeup the monitor using the DAP.The effect of setting this bit to 1 is not affected by the value of the MON_EN bit.A debugger can set MON_PEND to 1, and force the processor to take a DebugMonitor exception, even when MON_EN is set to 0.

enumeratedValue.name: MON_PEND_0
enumeratedValue.description: Clear the status of the DebugMonitor exception to not pending.

enumeratedValue.name: MON_PEND_1
enumeratedValue.description: Set the status of the DebugMonitor exception to pending.

field.name: MON_STEP
field.description: MON_STEP bit. When MON_EN is set to 0, this feature is disabled and the processor ignores MON_STEP.When MON_EN is set to 1, the meaning of MON_STEP is:0 = Do not step the processor.1 = Step the processor.Setting this bit to 1 makes the step request pending. The request becomes active when the processor returns from the DebugMonitor handler to the code being debugged. The effect of setting this bit to 1 is UNPREDICTABLE if the code being debugged is executing at an execution priority that is lower than the priority of the DebugMonitor exception.This is the debug monitor equivalent of DHCSR.C_STEP in Debug state.

enumeratedValue.name: MON_STEP_0
enumeratedValue.description: Do not step the processor.

enumeratedValue.name: MON_STEP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Step the processor.

field.name: MON_REQ
field.description: DebugMonitor semaphore bit. The processor does not use this bit. The monitor software defines the meaning and use of this bit.

field.name: TRCENA
field.description: TRCENA bit. Global enable for all DWT and ITM features.If the DWT and ITM blocks are not implemented, this bit is UNK/SBZP.When TRCENA is set to 0:- DWT registers return UNKNOWN values on reads. Whether the processor ignores writes to the DWT unit is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED.- ITM registers return UNKNOWN values on reads. Whether the processor ignores writes to the ITM unit is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED.Setting this bit to 0 might not stop all events. To ensure all events are stopped, software must set all DWT and ITM feature enable bits to 0, and then set this bit to 0.The effect of this bit on the TPIU, ETM, and other system trace components is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED.

enumeratedValue.name: TRCENA_0
enumeratedValue.description: DWT and ITM blocks disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TRCENA_1
enumeratedValue.description: DWT and ITM blocks enabled.

field.name: ASC
field.description: Each bit in the ASC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the crossbar switch's slave input port.

enumeratedValue.name: ASC_0

enumeratedValue.name: ASC_1
enumeratedValue.description: A bus slave connection to AXBS input port n is present

enumeratedValue.name: LGO_1
enumeratedValue.description: Write: initiate line command indicated by bits CLCR[27:24]. Read: line command active.
